Acid Spray Fountain.name: 酸雾喷泉 Acid Spray Fountain
Acid Spray Fountain.disable: 对喷泉进行一次@Check[type:thievery|dc:26|name:Disable the Fountain|traits:complex,mechanical,trap](专家)使其停止喷射酸液，或通过一次@Check[type:thievery|dc:22|name:Disable a Fountain Nozzle|traits:complex,mechanical,trap](专家)拆掉一个喷嘴并使陷阱的动作数减少1。当动作数减少到0时喷泉被解除。
Acid Spray Fountain.hazarddescription: 一个带有三个喷嘴的隐藏的酸性喷泉连接着房间中的八个压力垫。
Acid Spray Fountain.reset: 陷阱会在1分钟后停止运作，那时它的酸液库已经耗尽了。在酸液库被重新注满之前无法重新激活。
Acid Spray Fountain.routine: (3动作) 在陷阱的先攻轮，它每有一个动作，就对房间里随机一个生物进行一次酸雾打击。

Fountain Activation.name: 喷泉激活 Fountain Activation
Fountain Activation.description:
触发 一个生物踩在压力垫上。

效果 陷阱会对房间里随机一个生物进行酸雾打击，不过首次伤害由于酸液在蚀穿隐蔽的箱子，会减少8点。然后陷阱骰先攻检定。

strike-Acid Spray.name: 酸雾 Acid Spray
strike-Acid Spray.description:
无多重攻击减值。

酸雾命中时造成[[/r 2d4[persistent,acid]]]，重击时为[[/r 4d4[persistent,acid]]]伤害。

No MAP.name: 无多重攻击减值 No MAP
No MAP.description: 酸雾打击没有多重攻击减值。

Adolescent Sea Serpent Algae.name: Adolescent Sea Serpent Algae

The water in the ballast organs around the sea serpent's neck is full of psychotropic algae.

Saving throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:20|name:Adolescent Sea Serpent Algae Poison]

Maximum duration 3 rounds

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{困惑 Confused} and, if flying, spends its first action each turn to descend 20 feet (1 round)

Spine Rake.name: Spine Rake

Coven.name: 巫团 Coven
Coven.description:
Ahksiva adds @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.J6vNvrUT3b1hx2iA]{Entangle}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.KSAEhNfZyXMO7Z7V]{Outcast's Curse}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.KsWhliKfUs3IpW3c]{Wall of Thorns} to her coven's spells.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Coven]

Sound Imitation.name: Sound Imitation
Sound Imitation.description: A green hag who succeeds at a Deception check to Lie can mimic the sounds of any animal found near her lair. She has a +4 circumstance bonus to this check.

Betraying Touch.name: Betraying Touch
Betraying Touch.description: Ahksiva touches a creature that doesn't realize she is an enemy. The betrayed creature is affected by her enfeebling humors and takes a -4 circumstance penalty to their saving throw against that effect.

Change Shape.name: 变身 Change Shape
Change Shape.description: Ahksiva can take on the appearance of any Medium humanoid woman. This doesn't change her Speed or her attack and damage bonuses with her Strikes, but might change the damage type her Strikes deal (typically to bludgeoning).

Enfeebling Humors.name: Enfeebling Humors
Enfeebling Humors.description: A creature damaged by a hag's claw must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:19] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} for 1 day. On a critical failure, or if it gets hit again and fails its save a second time, it's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} for 1 day.

Exhale Miasma.name: Exhale Miasma
Exhale Miasma.description: Ahksiva exhales a miasma of green vapors. Each living creature in a @Template[type:cone|distance:15] is affected by her enfeebling humors (attempting a save as normal). She can't use again for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4轮}.

Tail Lash.name: Tail Lash
Tail Lash.description:
触发 A creature within reach of Ahrkinos's tail uses an action to Strike or attempt a skill check.

效果 Ahrkinos attempts to Strike the triggering creature with his tail. If he hits, the creature takes a -2 circumstance penalty to the triggering roll.

Caustic Mucus.name: Caustic Mucus
Caustic Mucus.description:
Ahrkinos spits a ball of caustic mucus up to a range of 50 feet that explodes in a @Template[type:burst|distance:10]. Creatures within the burst take [[/r 5d6[acid]]] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:20|basic:true] save). Those that fail this save also take [[/r 1d6[persistent,acid]]] damage and take a -5-foot status penalty to their Speed. This Speed reduction ends with the persistent acid damage.

Ahrkinos can't use again for [[/br 1d6 #rounds]]{1d6轮}.

Draconic Frenzy.name: Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: Ahrkinos makes one fangs Strike and two tail Strikes in any order.

Old Bones.name: Old Bones
Old Bones.description: Ahrkinos's age has left him infirm and makes it difficult for him to fly. Ahrkinos becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} if he uses more than one Fly action to fly in a single round. His Speed Surge is considered one Fly action for this purpose. In addition, he immediately begins to fall at the end of his turn if he is flying, but treats the fall as 40 feet shorter.

Speed Surge.name: Speed Surge
Speed Surge.description: Ahrkinos moves up to twice his Speed. He can do this three times per day.

Pounce.description: The fox Strides and makes a Strike at the end of that movement. If the fox begins this action hidden, it remains hidden until after this ability's Strike.

Ankle Trap (1-2).name: Ankle Trap (1-2)
Ankle Trap (1-2).disable: If spotted, the pits can be avoided by moving at one quarter of normal speed.
Ankle Trap (1-2).hazarddescription: Many small pits have been dug in the road and covered with leaves and dirt to disguise them.

Annis Hag (1-06).name: Annis Hag (1-06)
Annis Hag (1-06).publicNotes:
Annis hags are brutal torturers and murderers, delighting in the musical screams and tasty flesh of young creatures and those who are pure of heart. Annis hags are the most direct of all hags, engaging in physical combat and using their change shape ability to hunt rather than to infiltrate and betray humanoids. But an Annis hag takes a grisly trophy from each kill and uses it to sow discord, sending the trophy to one of her victim's loved ones in a way that implicates another family member in the murder. Also known as iron hags, annis hags have iron-like yet flexible flesh that resists edged weapons, and their own touch is the same cold iron that burns the flesh of other hags. This allows them to bully their way to the leadership of hag covens.

Malevolent crones who lurk at the edges of civilization, hags use their deceptive, magical abilities to prey upon humanoids, manipulating and corrupting them. Some say hags arose from fey that became twisted by their inner selfishness. Hags gather together in covens for greater power, craft unique magical items known as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.ACa9QlFqdmW4s2Th]{Hag Eyes}, and are known to replace infant humanoids with their own offspring-these children are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.bAjHCeyNcPRqOmLv]{Changelings} who have the potential to become hags themselves.

Coven.name: 巫团 Coven
Coven.description:
An annis hag adds @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.gPvtmKMRpg9I9D7H]{Earthbind}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.115Xp9E38CJENhNS]{Passwall}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.8Umt1AzYfFbC4fui]{Spellwrack} to her coven's spells.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Coven]

Bonds of Iron.name: Bonds of Iron
Bonds of Iron.description:
Once per day, an annis hag can cause a cage built of cold iron fingernails to spring out of nothingness at a range of up to 30 feet, attempting an @Check[type:athletics|traits:action:grapple|overrideTraits:true] check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple} against the target's Fortitude DC; if the target has a weakness to cold iron, the annis hag gains a +2 circumstance bonus to this check.

Unlike a normal Grapple, the annis hag doesn't need to be within reach and can move as she pleases, and a successful attempt lasts until the creature escapes (DC 24), causing the cage to crumble into rust.

Any creature can attempt to destroy the cage by attacking it. It has an AC of 19, Hardness 10, and 40 Hit Points.

Change Shape.name: 变身 Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
The hag can take on the appearance of any Medium female humanoid. This doesn't change her Speed or her attack and damage bonuses with her Strikes but might change the damage type her Strikes deal (typically to bludgeoning).

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Automatic Fire Suppression (3-4).disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:17|name:Neutralize Automatic Fire Suppression|traits:mechanical,trap] (受训) to jam the sprinkler system or @Check[type:engineering-lore|dc:15|name:Disable Control Panel|traits:mechanical,trap]{Engineering Lore} (受训) on the control panel on the north wall to turn the system off.
Automatic Fire Suppression (3-4).hazarddescription: Ceiling sprinklers spray in response to any fire in the room.

Automatic Fire Suppression (5-6).name: Automatic Fire Suppression (5-6)
Automatic Fire Suppression (5-6).disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:22|name:Neutralize Automatic Fire Suppression|traits:mechanical,trap] (受训) to jam the sprinkler system or @Check[type:engineering-lore|dc:18|name:Disable Control Panel|traits:mechanical,trap]{Engineering Lore} (受训) on the control panel on the north wall to turn the system off.
Automatic Fire Suppression (5-6).hazarddescription: Ceiling sprinklers spray in response to any fire in the room.

Cheap Shot.name: Cheap Shot
Cheap Shot.description: The bandit disciple deals an extra [[/r 1 #precision]]{1 precision damage} to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} creatures.

Dirty Trick.name: Dirty Trick
Dirty Trick.description:
需求 A bandit disciple is holding a pouch of fine sand.

效果 The disciple Strides. If they end their movement adjacent to an enemy, they can make a @Check[type:deception|name:Deception Check vs. Target Perception] check against that enemy's Perception DC.

Critical Success As success, and the enemy also takes [[/r 1 #precision]]{1 extra precision damage}.

Success The enemy takes [[/r 1d4[fire]]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 round.

Failure No effect.

Critical Failure The bandit disciple drops their pouch of fine sand, spilling and rendering it useless.

Cheap Shot.name: Cheap Shot
Cheap Shot.description: The bandit disciple deals an extra [[/r 1 #precision]]{1d4 precision damage} to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} creatures.

Dirty Trick.name: Dirty Trick
Dirty Trick.description:
需求 A bandit disciple is holding a pouch of fine sand.

效果 The disciple Strides. If they end their movement adjacent to an enemy, they can make a @Check[type:deception|name:Deception Check vs. Target Perception] check against that enemy's Perception DC.

Critical Success As success, and the enemy also takes [[/r 2 #precision]]{2 extra precision damage}.

Success The enemy takes [[/r 1d4[piercing]]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 round.

Failure No effect.

Critical Failure The bandit disciple drops their pouch of fine sand, spilling and rendering it useless.

Single Out.name: Single Out
Single Out.description: The bandit designates one target it can see at a time. Against that target its multiple attack penalty becomes -3 (-2 with an agile weapon) and -6 (-4 with an agile weapon) for 1 minute

Sneak Attack.name: 偷袭 Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: The bandit deals an extra [[/r {1d6}[precision]]]{1d6 precision damage} to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{措手不及 Flat-Footed} creatures.

Attach.name: Attach
Attach.description:
When a barbed bloodseeker hits a target larger than itself, its barbed legs attach it to that creature. This is similar to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbing} the creature, but the bloodseeker moves with that creature rather than holding it in place.

The bloodseeker is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{措手不及 Flat-Footed} while attached. If the bloodseeker is killed or pushed away while attached to a creature it has drained blood from, that creature takes [[/r 1[persistent,bleed]]] damage. Escaping the attach or removing the bloodseeker in other ways doesn't cause bleed damage.

Blood Drain.name: Blood Drain
Blood Drain.description:
需求 The bloodseeker is attached to a creature.

效果 The bloodseeker uses its proboscis to drain blood from the creature it's attached to. This deals [[/r 1d6]]{1d6 damage}, and the bloodseeker gains temporary Hit Points equal to the damage dealt. A creature that has its blood drained by a bloodseeker is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} until it receives healing (of any kind or amount).

Counterspell.name: Counterspell
Counterspell.description:
触发 A creature Casts a Spell Barralbus has prepared.

效果 Barralbus expends a prepared spell to counter the triggering creature's casting of the same spell. He loses the spell slot as if he had cast the triggering spell. He then attempts to counteract the triggering spell.

Bijan And Zaynap Ohrlavi.name: 比简和载娜普·欧何拉维 Bijan And Zaynap Ohrlavi
Bijan And Zaynap Ohrlavi.allSaves: 对抗毒素时全豁免+1状态加值

Infused Items.name: 灌注物品 Infused Items
Infused Items.description: 每个炼金术士携带2个灌注中级强酸瓶，2个灌注中级瓶装闪电，2个灌注中级寒霜瓶。这些物品会持续24小时，或者直到下次炼金术士进行日常准备。

Alchemist Goggles.name: 炼金护目镜 Alchemist Goggles
Alchemist Goggles.description: 炼金术士的@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.7JVgLiNTAs4clEW8]{炼金护目镜 Alchemist Goggles}允许他们在使用炼金炸弹进行攻击时忽略弱效掩蔽。

Calculated Bomber.name: 溅射演算 Calculated Bomber
Calculated Bomber.description: 炼金术士投掷炼金炸弹时造成5点溅射伤害，取代原本的数值。

Quick Bomber.name: 高速投弹 Quick Bomber
Quick Bomber.description: 炼金术士用一个交互动作取出一个炼金炸弹，并用其进行远程打击。

Sneak Attack.name: 偷袭 Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: 如果炼金术士的打击命中措手不及的生物，可造成[[/r {1d6}[precision]]]]{1d6额外精准伤害}。

Biloko Veteran (1-16).name: Biloko Veteran (1-16)
Biloko Veteran (1-16).publicNotes:
A biloko who has led a sufficient number of successful hunts garners the respect (and fear) of their companions.

Bilokos are crocodile-snouted fey who stalk the Mwangi Jungle and feast upon the flesh of humanoids. As cunning as they are vicious, bilokos employ deadly traps and guerrilla hunting tactics to capture prey-typically hapless explorers or, occasionally, wayward villagers, many of whom believe bilokos to be cruel ancestral spirits. The most powerful of these creatures, known as elokos, wield potent transformative magic.

Bilokos have a fondness for bells, and the sound of ringing bells often indicates their presence. In addition to carrying and ringing them while out hunting, bilokos sometimes enchant bells with potent magic, or hang them on strings to serve as alarms for their encampments.

Bilokos look like slender but wiry humanoids with crocodile-like heads, rust-colored skin, and blood-red eyes. They eat only the meat of humanoids, though they can survive for extended periods of time on a single meal thanks to their snakelike ability to consume a Medium humanoid creature whole. They do this by unhinging their jaws and slowly swallowing the victim from head to foot. Thanks to their acidic saliva and sharp teeth, a biloko can masticate their food into an easy-to-digest pulp, grinding flesh and bone into a compact mush, even while swallowing; thus, they do not flinch while devouring meals two or three times their own size.

A recently-fed biloko can be easily recognized by their sagging, distended belly. However, despite their slow appearance, the fey is no less dangerous then, as they delight in killing and might have hungry comrades hiding nearby, waiting to feed.

Biloko Warrior (1-16).name: Biloko Warrior (1-16)
Biloko Warrior (1-16).publicNotes:
Bilokos prefer to move in small, stealthy packs through dark, isolated sections of the forest. When a band of bilokos finds a suitable hunting ground, they claim the area exclusively, digging pit traps, crafting snares from vines, and building blinds high in trees where they can lie in ambush.

Boggard Pit (3-4).hazarddescription: A net with soil and aquatic plants on it covers a 10-foot pit dug into the bottom of a body of water.
Boggard Pit (3-4).reset: Others can fall into the pit, but the net entangles only the first creature to trigger the trap. The net must be reset manually.

Boggard Pit (5-6).disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:18|name:Remove the Net|traits:mechanical,trap] to remove the net

Boggard Swampseer (PFS 1-24).name: Boggard Swampseer (PFS 1-24)
Boggard Swampseer (PFS 1-24).publicNotes:
The boggard swampseer has been gifted with magic through its worship of the demon lord Gogunta, and uses its power to rule a boggard village, keeping the rest of the village in line and planning raids on nearby communities.

Boggards are aggressive humanoid amphibians that thrive in swamps, marshes, and even some rain forests. Boggards hatch from eggs into tadpoles, fiercely competing for food and even consuming their siblings in that struggle. Over 3 years, the surviving boggards develops arms, legs, and lungs while learning the rudiments of hunting, crafts, and warfare-everything needed to survive in their might-makes-right society. At the top of most boggard hierarchies lords a hulking swampseer imbued with sinister divine magic.

Boggard Warrior (PFS 1-09).name: Boggard Warrior (PFS 1-09)
Boggard Warrior (PFS 1-09).publicNotes:
Boggard warriors exalt in single combat, and prefer to fight alone so that none can contest their kills. They have been known to pursue enemies who flee combat with a single-mindedness that seems almost supernatural.

Swamp Stride.name: Swamp Stride
Swamp Stride.description: A boggard warrior ignores difficult terrain caused by swamp terrain features.

Terrifying Croak.name: Terrifying Croak
Terrifying Croak.description:
The boggard warrior unleashes a terrifying croak. Any non-boggard within @Template[type:emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} unless they succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:18] save.

Those who critically succeed are temporarily immune for 1 minute.

Tongue Grab.name: Tongue Grab
Tongue Grab.description:
If the boggard warrior hits a creature with its tongue, that creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} by the boggard. Unlike with a normal grab, the creature isn't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}, but it can't move beyond the reach of the boggard's tongue.

A creature can sever the tongue by hitting AC 15 and dealing at least 3 slashing damage. Though this doesn't deal any damage to the boggard, it prevents it from using its tongue Strike until it regrows its tongue, which takes a week.

Pack Attack.name: Pack Attack
Pack Attack.description: The cinder wolf's Strikes deal 1d4 extra precision damage to creatures within reach of at least two of the wolf's allies.

Smoke Vision.name: Smoke Vision
Smoke Vision.description: The cinder wolf ignores the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from smoke.

Pack Attack.name: Pack Attack
Pack Attack.description: The cinder wolf's Strikes deal 1d4 extra precision damage to creatures within reach of at least two of the wolf's allies.

Collapsing Barricade (1-2).name: Collapsing Barricade (1-2)
Collapsing Barricade (1-2).disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:18] (受训) to carefully trigger the collapse without entering the tunnel or @Check[type:thievery|dc:22] (受训) to brace the tunnel so it is safe to pass through.
Collapsing Barricade (1-2).hazarddescription: A tunnel through this steep barricade is rigged to collapse. If a kobold spends one action to throw a lever, the tunnel collapses on the next creature to pass through.

Collapsing Ceiling (1-2).disable: @Check[type:crafting|dc:19] (受训) to reinforce the ceiling with boards from the broken door.

Collapse.description:
触发 A creature walks into the area beneath the centipede lair.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage.

Failure The creature takes full damage.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage and is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{倒地 Prone}.

Pitfall.name: 坠坑 Pitfall
Pitfall.description:
触发 一个生物走到坑旁边。

效果 该触发生物坠落，承受坠落伤害（通常为[[/r 3[bludgeoning]]]伤害）以及坠落到破碎的板材上的[[/r 4d6[piercing]]]伤害。

该生物可以尝试@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.3yoajuKjwHZ9ApUY]{抓住边缘 Grab an Edge}来避免坠落；@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.pprgrYQ1QnIDGZiy]{攀爬 Climb}墙壁和抓住边缘的的DC为18。

Creeping Slime.name: Creeping Slime
Creeping Slime.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:17] (受训) to carefully push the slime away without causing it to grow, @Check[type:crafting|dc:17] (one action) to neutralize it with alchemical reagents, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{解除魔法 Dispel Magic} (2nd level; counteract DC 15 [DC 18 in Subtier 3-4]) to counteract the magic animating it. Casting a 1st-level or higher spell with the water trait washes away the slime.
Creeping Slime.hazarddescription: The thick green slime has been imbued with foul hag magic, making it cling to and grow over living creatures that touch it.

Coat with Slime.name: Coat with Slime
Coat with Slime.description:
触发 A creature steps into the slime covering the steps and upper landing.

效果 The slime rapidly climbs across the creature's body, grows cold, and congeals. Creatures assaulted by the slime take [[/r (1d8+5)[cold]]] damage(@Check[type:fortitude|dc:17|basic:true] save); creatures that fail their save are also coated in slime, imposing a -5 foot circumstance penalty to their Speeds. The slime can't be easily cleaned away, and it requires ten minutes of bathing with clean water and soap to remove the slime.

Crowd Aid.name: 人群援助 Crowd Aid
Crowd Aid.description: 人群煽动者忽略友好的人群造成的困难地形。和友好的人群相邻的生物在对抗人群煽动者的攻击时@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{措手不及 Flat-Footed}。

Crowd Aid.name: 人群援助 Crowd Aid
Crowd Aid.description:
人群领头人忽略友好的人群造成的困难地形。

和友好的人群相邻的生物在对抗人群领头人的攻击时@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{措手不及 Flat-Footed}。

Crowd with Chamberpots.name: 扔夜壶的人群 Crowd with Chamberpots
Crowd with Chamberpots.disable: 在人群中已经动摇或者承受伤害的的人数超过了剩余站着的人群领头人数量，人群会散开。对于影响一个区域的效果，将每一格记为一个人群的成员。
Crowd with Chamberpots.hazarddescription: 愤怒的人群向冒犯者投掷夜壶，但还没到以身犯险的程度。该人群充满九个连续的方格，并且能够改变形状填充街区。角色能够移动穿过人群，但是被人群占据的位置是困难地形。
Crowd with Chamberpots.reset: 在人群中已经动摇或者承受伤害的的人数超过了剩余站着的人群领头人数量，人群会散开。对于影响一个区域的效果，将每一格记为一个人群的成员。
Crowd with Chamberpots.routine: (3动作) 该人群使用其第一个动作来行走以远离任何和他们相邻的敌人（或者以靠近到30尺内），之后使用每个剩余的动作来对一个不同的目标尝试一次夜壶打击。

Damaged Alchemical Golem.name: Damaged Alchemical Golem
Damaged Alchemical Golem.publicNotes:
This golem is a walking alchemical nightmare capable of inflicting all manner of painful wounds. Its ability to follow orders is granted by the otherwise mindless humanoid brain that floats in its dome-like head. In exceptionally rare cases, the brain used in its creation might retain fragments of memories or even actual intellect, resulting in an alchemical golem with a personality and agenda of its own.

Crafted of base materials and then magically animated into a powerful guardian, the legendary golem is a living construct that mindlessly obeys its creator's commands-often continuing to do so for years or even centuries after its creator's death. There exist two known methods of animating a golem. The traditional method involves harvesting and implanting an elemental soul or essence within the newly crafted host statue, a procedure seen as vile and blasphemous to those who value the sanctity of the soul; evil or amoral golem crafters tend to prefer this method. The other, less disreputable technique involves siphoning pure positive energy into the statue to artificially imitate the creation of a soul. The result does not give the golem a true soul and is generally a more costly and time-consuming method of creation. Regardless of the method used, the resulting golem functions the same. A golem's unique animating force leaves it susceptible to certain forms of magic, but apart from these few weaknesses, it is impervious to magic and difficult to damage with weapons.

Golems work best in play as foes to vanquish rather than allies to accompany player characters on adventures. The process of creating a golem is time-consuming, expensive, and difficult, and only the most talented spellcasters or artisans can even hope to accomplish such an undertaking. While certain magical texts-so-called "golem manuals"-are said to aid golems crafters, for the most part the creation of a golem should be something left in the hands of the Game Master.

Golems have components that can be harvested as trophies or magical components; the value depends on the golem in question. Examples of components that can be harvested from golems are listed in the sidebars.

Alchemical Rupture.name: Alchemical Rupture
Alchemical Rupture.description:
When an alchemical golem takes physical damage from a critical hit or is affected by a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.1xbFBQDRs0hT5xZ9]{Shatter} spell, one glass chamber within its body shatters, spewing alchemical liquid in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5].

Roll on the altered alchemical chambers list to determine which one shatters, and any creatures hit are affected as listed (@Check[type:reflex|dc:24]).

[[/br {1d6}[Alchemical Effect] #Alchemical Chambers]]{1d6} Alchemical Effect
1-2 @Check[type:fortitude|dc:19] or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} on a critical failure)
3-4 @Check[type:fortitude|dc:19] or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 2} on a critical failure)
5-6 @Check[type:fortitude|dc:19] or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed} for 1 round (slowed for 2 rounds on a critical failure)

Altered Alchemical Chambers.name: Altered Alchemical Chambers
Altered Alchemical Chambers.description:
The damaged alchemical golem's chemicals have changed after a long period of inactivity. When an alchemical golem ability calls upon a randomly determined alchemical effect, roll 1d6 and consult the following (if you roll the result of a chamber that was shattered, there is no alchemical effect):

[[/br {1d6}[Alchemical Effect] #Alchemical Chambers]]{1d6} Alchemical Effect
1-2 @Check[type:fortitude|dc:19] or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} on a critical failure)
3-4 @Check[type:fortitude|dc:19] or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 2} on a critical failure)
5-6 @Check[type:fortitude|dc:19] or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed} for 1 round (slowed for 2 rounds on a critical failure)

Golem Antimagic.name: Golem Antimagic
Golem Antimagic.description:
harmed by sonic ([[/r {1d8}]]{1d8 damage}, [[/r {1d6}]]{1d6 damage} from areas or persistent damage; slowed by cold

A golem is immune to spells and magical abilities other than its own, but each type of golem is affected by a few types of magic in special ways. If an entry lists multiple types (such as "cold and water"), either type of spell can affect the golem.

Harmed By Any magic of this type that targets the golem causes it to take the listed amount of damage (this damage has no type) instead of the usual effect. If the golem starts its turn in an area of magic of this type or is affected by a persistent effect of the appropriate type, it takes the damage listed in the parenthetical.

Healed By Any magic of this type that targets the golem makes the golem lose the slowed condition and gain HP equal to half the damage the spell would have dealt. If the golem starts its turn in an area of this type of magic, it gains the HP listed in the parenthetical.

Slowed By Any magic of this type that targets the golem causes it to be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 1} for [[/br 2d6 #rounds]]{2d6轮} instead of the usual effect. If the golem starts its turn in an area of this type of magic, it's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 1} for that round.

Vulnerable To Each golem is vulnerable to one or more specific spells, with the effects described in its stat block.

Alchemical Injection.name: Alchemical Injection
Alchemical Injection.description:
When an alchemical golem hits a creature with a syringe Strike, roll 1d6 on the alchemical chambers list to determine the additional effect of the attack.

The syringe exposes the creature to the effect rolled.

[[/br {1d6}[Alchemical Effect] #Alchemical Chambers]]{1d6} Alchemical Effect
1-2 @Check[type:fortitude|dc:19] or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} on a critical failure)
3-4 @Check[type:fortitude|dc:19] or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 2} on a critical failure)
5-6 @Check[type:fortitude|dc:19] or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed} for 1 round (slowed for 2 rounds on a critical failure)

Dead Organ (5-6).name: Dead Organ (5-6)
Dead Organ (5-6).disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:25|name:Stopper the Pipes SC|traits:magical,necromancy](专家)to stopper the pipes. Each pipe stoppered imparts a stacking -1 circumstance penalty to Performance checks with the organ. Once four pipes have been stoppered, the organ ceases to function.
Dead Organ (5-6).hazarddescription: A magical pipe organ for controlling and bolstering the undead. Creatures that are trained in Performance can spend one action to attempt to play a tune.

Dead Organ (7-8).name: Dead Organ (7-8)
Dead Organ (7-8).disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:28|name:Stopper the Pipes SC|traits:magical,necromancy](专家)to stopper the pipes. Each pipe stoppered imparts a stacking -1 circumstance penalty to Performance checks with the organ. Once four pipes have been stoppered, the organ ceases to function.
Dead Organ (7-8).hazarddescription: A magical pipe organ for controlling and bolstering the undead. Creatures that are trained in Performance can spend one action to attempt to play a tune.

Deadfall Trap (1-2).name: Deadfall Trap (1-2)
Deadfall Trap (1-2).disable: The trap cannot be disabled in advance.
Deadfall Trap (1-2).hazarddescription: A large tree has been cut down and supported only by a rope.

Deadfall Trap (3-4).name: Deadfall Trap (3-4)
Deadfall Trap (3-4).disable: The trap cannot be disabled in advance (unless the PCs are able to out stealth Vengeant Thorn and sneak up on him before the wagon reaches the target zone).
Deadfall Trap (3-4).hazarddescription: A large tree has been cut down and supported only by a rope.

Deeply Flawed Ritual.name: 有严重缺陷的仪式 Deeply Flawed Ritual
Deeply Flawed Ritual.disable:
仪式环内出现了七个缺陷，如影子的火焰般跳动着。每位清醒的塔夫瓦尔的助手保持一个缺陷受控，但其他的必须在塔夫瓦尔失去意识前修复。

每个缺陷可以通过一次成功的@Check[type:occultism|dc:24]检定或者对应缺陷初始原因的DC20（受训）技能检定（见后文表仪式缺陷和解决）。无论成功与否，尝试神秘检定来解除危害的PC会了解到缺陷的成因，以及克服它可以使用的技能。

每当使用这些其他的技能修复缺陷的检定成功时，使用神秘检定修复一个缺陷的DC减少2。每当击败一个幽影微灵，PC修复一个缺陷。

d4 缺陷的成因 用以克服的技能
1 被骚扰（在奥秘学院“要么发文要么死”的传统，使得塔夫瓦尔被迫在仪式执行中投机取巧，所以一些符文没有正确绘制） @Check[type:arcana|dc:20] (受训)或@Check[type:thievery|dc:20] (受训)
2 情感错位（塔夫瓦尔来自奈达尔，潜意识里希望这仪式能显出她故乡的一些优点；她在符文中加入了一些阴影语，并增强了能量） @Check[type:society|dc:20] (受训)或@Check[type:religion|dc:20] (受训)
3 与世隔绝（塔夫瓦尔没有做多少现场工作，并且把符文用的墨水中所需要的一种蘑菇搞错了） @Check[type:crafting|dc:20] (受训)或@Check[type:nature|dc:20] (受训)
4 束手束脚（塔夫瓦尔自身的犹豫和自我怀疑让仪式逐渐脱离她的控制） @Check[type:deception|dc:20] (受训)或@Check[type:diplomacy|dc:20] (受训)
Deeply Flawed Ritual.hazarddescription: 一个有缺陷的仪式，释放出幽影能量，并撕开了一个影界的裂口。
Deeply Flawed Ritual.routine:
(1动作) 在其每一回合的开始，该仪式释放一股幽影能量，对在上一轮中参与仪式的每个角色造成[[/r 4d6[negative]]]伤害（@Check[type:fortitude|dc:22|basic:true|name:Flawed Ritual]豁免）（包括塔夫瓦尔和她的助手，以及任何尝试技能检定来接触危害的PC）。非参与者能以一个反应动作站到参与者前方。这会阻挡对仪式施法者造成的伤害，但是此非参与者必须尝试这次强韧豁免。

除了造成伤害意外，该仪式的能量涌动也会将一个@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pfs-season-1-bestiary.3fctnHmcLQM3KrZj]{高等幽影微灵 Greater Shadow Wisp}送入房间内。如果房间内已经有两个微灵，该仪式不再创造新的微灵，而是恢复每个微灵[[/r 10[healing]]]{10生命值}。

Ritual Anchor.name: 仪式锚 Ritual Anchor
Ritual Anchor.description: 如果塔夫瓦尔死亡，该仪式会立即灾难性地结束。在一声响亮的爆破后，它发生了爆炸，在屋内充满负能量，之后消失。这会结束该仪式，但是不会移除任何已经在房间内的幽影。

Gallop.name: Gallop
Gallop.description: Desert Wind Strides twice. He has a +10-foot circumstance bonus to his Speed during these Strides.

Crafted of base materials and then magically animated into a powerful guardian, the legendary golem is a living construct that mindlessly obeys its creator's commands-often continuing to do so for years or even centuries after its creator's death. There exist two known methods of animating a golem. The traditional method involves harvesting and implanting an elemental soul or essence within the newly crafted host statue, a procedure seen as vile and blasphemous to those who value the sanctity of the soul; evil or amoral golem crafters tend to prefer this method. The other, less disreputable technique involves siphoning pure positive energy into the statue to artificially imitate the creation of a soul. The result does not give the golem a true soul and is generally a more costly and time-consuming method of creation. Regardless of the method used, the resulting golem functions the same. A golem's unique animating force leaves it susceptible to certain forms of magic, but apart from these few weaknesses, it is impervious to magic and difficult to damage with weapons.

Golems work best in play as foes to vanquish rather than allies to accompany player characters on adventures. The process of creating a golem is time-consuming, expensive, and difficult, and only the most talented spellcasters or artisans can even hope to accomplish such an undertaking. While certain magical texts-so-called "golem manuals"-are said to aid golems crafters, for the most part the creation of a golem should be something left in the hands of the Game Master.

Golems have components that can be harvested as trophies or magical components; the value depends on the golem in question. Examples of components that can be harvested from golems are listed in the sidebars.

Alchemical Rupture.name: Alchemical Rupture
Alchemical Rupture.description:
When an alchemical golem takes physical damage from a critical hit or is affected by a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.1xbFBQDRs0hT5xZ9]{Shatter} spell, one glass chamber within its body shatters, spewing alchemical liquid in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5].

Roll on the altered alchemical chambers list to determine which one shatters, and any creatures hit are affected as listed (@Check[type:reflex|dc:16]).

[[/br {1d6}[Alchemical Effect] #Alchemical Chambers]]{1d6} Alchemical Effect
1-2 @Check[type:fortitude|dc:15] or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} on a critical failure)
3-4 @Check[type:fortitude|dc:15] or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 2} on a critical failure)
5-6 @Check[type:fortitude|dc:15] or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed} for 1 round (slowed for 2 rounds on a critical failure)

Altered Alchemical Chambers.name: Altered Alchemical Chambers
Altered Alchemical Chambers.description:
The dilapidated alchemical golem's chemicals have changed after a long period of inactivity. When an alchemical golem ability calls upon a randomly determined alchemical effect, roll 1d6 and consult the following (if you roll the result of a chamber that was shattered, there is no alchemical effect):

[[/br {1d6}[Alchemical Effect] #Alchemical Chambers]]{1d6} Alchemical Effect
1-2 @Check[type:fortitude|dc:15] or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} on a critical failure)
3-4 @Check[type:fortitude|dc:15] or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 2} on a critical failure)
5-6 @Check[type:fortitude|dc:15] or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed} for 1 round (slowed for 2 rounds on a critical failure)

Golem Antimagic.name: Golem Antimagic
Golem Antimagic.description:
harmed by sonic ([[/r {1d8}]]{1d8 damage}, [[/r {1d6}]]{1d6 damage} from areas or persistent damage; slowed by cold

A golem is immune to spells and magical abilities other than its own, but each type of golem is affected by a few types of magic in special ways. If an entry lists multiple types (such as "cold and water"), either type of spell can affect the golem.

Harmed By Any magic of this type that targets the golem causes it to take the listed amount of damage (this damage has no type) instead of the usual effect. If the golem starts its turn in an area of magic of this type or is affected by a persistent effect of the appropriate type, it takes the damage listed in the parenthetical.

Healed By Any magic of this type that targets the golem makes the golem lose the slowed condition and gain HP equal to half the damage the spell would have dealt. If the golem starts its turn in an area of this type of magic, it gains the HP listed in the parenthetical.

Slowed By Any magic of this type that targets the golem causes it to be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 1} for [[/br 2d6 #rounds]]{2d6轮} instead of the usual effect. If the golem starts its turn in an area of this type of magic, it's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 1} for that round.

Vulnerable To Each golem is vulnerable to one or more specific spells, with the effects described in its stat block.

Alchemical Injection.name: Alchemical Injection
Alchemical Injection.description:
When an alchemical golem hits a creature with a syringe Strike, roll 1d6 on the alchemical chambers list to determine the additional effect of the attack.

The syringe exposes the creature to the effect rolled.

[[/br {1d6}[Alchemical Effect] #Alchemical Chambers]]{1d6} Alchemical Effect
1-2 @Check[type:fortitude|dc:15] or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} on a critical failure)
3-4 @Check[type:fortitude|dc:15] or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 2} on a critical failure)
5-6 @Check[type:fortitude|dc:15] or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed} for 1 round (slowed for 2 rounds on a critical failure)

Pack Attack.name: Pack Attack
Pack Attack.description: The dire cinder wolf's Strikes deal 1d4 extra precision damage to creatures within reach of at least two of the wolf's allies.

Worry.name: Worry
Worry.description:
需求 The dire cinder wolf has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} with its jaws

效果 The dire wolf fiercely shakes the grabbed creature with its teeth, dealing [[/r {(1d10+2)[piercing],1[fire]}]]{1d10+2 piercing damage plus 1 fire damage} (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:20|basic:true] save).

Heft Crate.name: Heft Crate
Heft Crate.description:
需求 The dockhand is adjacent to a crate

效果 The dockhand picks up a crate and heaves it up to 15 feet. Upon landing, the crate breaks open in a @Template[type:burst|distance:5]. Each creature within the area takes [[/r 2d6[bludgeoning]]] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:13|basic:true] save), and the area becomes difficult terrain until cleared.

Swig.name: Swig
Swig.description: The dockhand Interacts to either draw a bottle of alcohol or pick up a nearby unattended bottle of alcohol and drink the whole thing. For 1 minute, the dockhand gains a +2 item bonus to melee damage rolls and saving throws against fear, but they become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1}.

Dryad (1-16).name: Dryad (1-16)
Dryad (1-16).publicNotes:
Dryads are fey guardians of the trees and creatures who dwell in wooded areas. They prefer using indirect methods to dissuade those who would harm their sacred groves and beloved forests, but they are not above using enchantments to enlist the aid of allies when evil threats cannot be dissuaded with words alone. In times of peace, dryads happily live secluded lives inside their trees, and a community at harmony with nature might not even realize a dryad lives nearby.

Though they watch over all the woods around them, dryads are inextricably tied to a specific tree, usually an oak. Dryads who are bonded to another type of tree are fundamentally the same, but they may differ in temperament and appearance to match their ward. For instance, kraneiai, or cherry-tree dryads, have beautiful pink coloration and concern themselves with the fragile beauty of life.

Nymphs are a family of fey that take the form of beautiful humanoids with elven features and have a deep association with the natural world. The most common of their kind are the dryads, which are spirits that embody great trees, but many other kinds of nymphs exist, including naiads, who watch over bodies of water. All nymphs are guardians of some element of nature, typically a specific tree or pond, or even-in the case of nymph queens-whole forests or massive bodies of water

Broad Swipe.name: Broad Swipe
Broad Swipe.description: The giant makes two Strikes with its glaive against two adjacent foes, both of whom are within its reach. The multiple attack penalty does not increase until after both attacks are resolved.

Terrifying Charge.name: Terrifying Charge
Terrifying Charge.description:
The giant Strides and makes a horns Strike with a +4 circumstance bonus to damage.

If the strike hits, the giant attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} the target.

Elite Boggard Swampseer (PFS 1-24, Anima.name: Elite Boggard Swampseer (PFS 1-24, Animal Staff)
Elite Boggard Swampseer (PFS 1-24, Anima.publicNotes:
The boggard swampseer has been gifted with magic through its worship of the demon lord Gogunta, and uses its power to rule a boggard village, keeping the rest of the village in line and planning raids on nearby communities.

Boggards are aggressive humanoid amphibians that thrive in swamps, marshes, and even some rain forests. Boggards hatch from eggs into tadpoles, fiercely competing for food and even consuming their siblings in that struggle. Over 3 years, the surviving boggards develops arms, legs, and lungs while learning the rudiments of hunting, crafts, and warfare-everything needed to survive in their might-makes-right society. At the top of most boggard hierarchies lords a hulking swampseer imbued with sinister divine magic.

Elite Boggard Swampseer (PFS 1-24, Staff.name: Elite Boggard Swampseer (PFS 1-24, Staff)
Elite Boggard Swampseer (PFS 1-24, Staff.publicNotes:
The boggard swampseer has been gifted with magic through its worship of the demon lord Gogunta, and uses its power to rule a boggard village, keeping the rest of the village in line and planning raids on nearby communities.

Boggards are aggressive humanoid amphibians that thrive in swamps, marshes, and even some rain forests. Boggards hatch from eggs into tadpoles, fiercely competing for food and even consuming their siblings in that struggle. Over 3 years, the surviving boggards develops arms, legs, and lungs while learning the rudiments of hunting, crafts, and warfare-everything needed to survive in their might-makes-right society. At the top of most boggard hierarchies lords a hulking swampseer imbued with sinister divine magic.

Elite Ghast (PFS 1-07).name: Elite Ghast (PFS 1-07)
Elite Ghast (PFS 1-07).publicNotes:
Ghasts-feral, foul-smelling, and constantly hungry-are the more powerful kin of ghouls. They are relentless in the pursuit of their prey.

Few creatures are more ubiquitous to sinister locations such as lonely graveyards and ruined crypts than the flesh-eating undead known as ghouls.

Attach.name: Attach
Attach.description: When a Glass River midge hits a target larger than itself, its barbed legs attach it to that creature. This is similar to Grabbing the creature, but the midge moves with that creature rather than holding it in place. The midge is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{措手不及 Flat-Footed} while attached. If the midge is killed or pushed away while attached to a creature it has drained blood from, that creature takes[[/r 1[persistent,bleed]]]{1} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]. @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escaping} the attach or removing the midge in other ways doesn't cause bleed damage.

Blood Drain.name: Blood Drain
Blood Drain.description:
需求 The Glass River midge is attached to a creature

效果 The midge uses its proboscis to drain blood from the creature it's attached to. This deals [[/r {1d4+2}]]{1d4+2 damage}, and the midge gains temporary Hit Points equal to the damage dealt. A creature that has its blood drained by a midge is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} until it receives healing (of any kind or amount).

Camouflage.name: Camouflage
Camouflage.description: The Glass River midge can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hide} in natural environments even if it doesn't have cover.

Elite Prefect (Fist) (3-4).name: Elite Prefect (Fist) (3-4)
Elite Prefect (Fist) (3-4).publicNotes: This NPC is the same as Prefect (3-4) with the elite template EXCEPT that its damage is 1d10+6 instead of 1d8+8.

Elite Sewer Ooze (Q9).name: Elite Sewer Ooze (Q9)
Elite Sewer Ooze (Q9).publicNotes:
These amorphous masses of sewage and other detritus make their way through filthy culverts beneath cities large and small.

Slimes, molds, and other oozes can be found in dank dungeons and shadowed forests. While not necessarily evil, some grow to enormous sizes and have insatiable appetites.

Elite Skeletal Giant (PFS 1-18).name: Elite Skeletal Giant (PFS 1-18)
Elite Skeletal Giant (PFS 1-18).publicNotes:
The reanimated bones of giants make excellent necromantic thralls.

Made from bones held together by foul necromancy, skeletons are among the most common types of undead, found haunting old dungeons and forgotten cemeteries.

Broad Swipe.name: Broad Swipe
Broad Swipe.description: The giant makes two Strikes with its glaive against two adjacent foes, both of whom are within its reach. The multiple attack penalty does not increase until after both attacks are resolved.

Terrifying Charge.name: Terrifying Charge
Terrifying Charge.description:
The giant Strides and makes a horns Strike with a +4 circumstance bonus to damage.

If the strike hits, the giant attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} the target.

Enraged Raven Swarm.name: Enraged Raven Swarm
Enraged Raven Swarm.publicNotes: A flock of ravens is known as an unkindness. Certainly the name lives up to its meaning when a swarm of ravens decides to work together. In most cases, a raven swarm like the one presented here won't attack larger foes, but when manipulated by supernatural forces or simple desperation born from hunger, an unkindness of ravens can be a surprisingly dangerous foe.

Flawed Ritual.name: 有缺陷的仪式 Flawed Ritual
Flawed Ritual.disable:
仪式环内出现了七个缺陷，如影子的火焰般跳动着。三位塔夫瓦尔的助手如果或者，他们各令一个缺陷受控，而塔夫瓦尔自己则负责避免仪式爆炸，如下文仪式锚能力所述。

每个缺陷可以通过一次成功的@Check[type:occultism|dc:22]检定或者对应缺陷初始原因的DC18（受训）技能检定（见后文表仪式缺陷和解决）。无论成功与否，尝试神秘（Occultism）检定来解除危害的PC会了解到缺陷的成因，以及克服它可以使用的技能。

每当使用这些其他的技能修复缺陷的检定成功时，使用神秘检定修复一个缺陷的DC减少2。PC可以改为强行令仪式稳定，而非使用技能检定。击败一个幽影微灵的PC自动修复一个缺陷。

d4 缺陷成因 用以克服的技能
1 被骚扰（在奥秘学院“要么发文要么死”的传统，使得塔夫瓦尔被迫在仪式执行中投机取巧，所以一些符文没有正确绘制） @Check[type:arcana|dc:18] (受训)或@Check[type:thievery|dc:18] (受训)
2 情感错位（塔夫瓦尔来自奈达尔，潜意识里希望这仪式能显出她故乡的一些优点；她在符文中加入了一些阴影语，并增强了能量） @Check[type:society|dc:18] (受训)或@Check[type:religion|dc:18] (受训)
3 与世隔绝（塔夫瓦尔没有做多少现场工作，并且把符文用的墨水中所需要的一种蘑菇搞错了） @Check[type:crafting|dc:18] (受训)或@Check[type:nature|dc:18] (受训)
4 束手束脚（塔夫瓦尔自身的犹豫和自我怀疑让仪式逐渐脱离她的控制） @Check[type:deception|dc:18] (受训)或@Check[type:diplomacy|dc:18] (受训)
Flawed Ritual.hazarddescription: 一个有缺陷的仪式，释放出幽影能量，并撕开了一个影界的裂口。
Flawed Ritual.routine:
(1动作) 在其每一回合的开始，该仪式释放一股幽影能量，对在上一轮中参与仪式的每个角色造成[[/r 2d6[negative]]]伤害（@Check[type:fortitude|dc:18|basic:true]豁免）（包括塔夫瓦尔和她的助手，以及任何尝试技能检定来接触危害的PC）。非参与者能以一个反应动作站到参与者前方。这会阻挡对仪式施法者造成的伤害，但是此非参与者必须尝试这次强韧豁免。

除了造成伤害意外，该仪式的能量涌动也会将一个@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pfs-season-1-bestiary.mjW1q98gMnEmZJKt]{幽影微灵 Shadow Wisp}送入房间内。微灵在该仪式的回合结束行动。如果房间内已经有两个幽影微灵，该仪式不再创造新的微灵，而是恢复每个微灵[[/r 10[healing]]]{10生命值}。

Ritual Anchor.name: 仪式锚 Ritual Anchor
Ritual Anchor.description: 如果塔夫瓦尔死亡，该仪式会立即灾难性地结束。在一声响亮的爆破后，它发生了爆炸，在屋内充满负能量，之后消失。这对区域B5中的所有生物造成[[/r 2d6[negative]]]伤害（@Check[type:fortitude|dc:18|basic:true|name:Flawed Ritual]豁免）。这些NPC仪式执行者会在这次豁免中自动大失败。这次爆炸会结束该仪式，但是不会移除任何已经在房间内的@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pfs-season-1-bestiary.mjW1q98gMnEmZJKt]{幽影微灵 Shadow Wisps}。

Fleshforge Dreg (Acid Spit).name: 血肉熔炉渣油 Fleshforge Dreg (酸性唾液)

Fleshforge Dreg (Breath Weapon).name: 血肉熔炉渣油 Fleshforge Dreg (喷吐武器)

该血肉熔炉渣油喷出火焰，对@Template[type:cone|distance:15]范围内所有生物造成[[/r 4d6[fire]]]伤害（@Check[type:reflex|dc:15|basic:true]豁免）。

该血肉熔炉渣油在[[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4轮}中无法再次使用其喷吐武器。

Fleshforge Dreg (Leaping Charge).name: 血肉熔炉渣油 Fleshforge Dreg (跳跃冲锋)

Leaping Charge.name: 跳跃冲锋 Leaping Charge
Leaping Charge.description: 该血肉熔炉原型行走至多10尺，由于它跳过障碍，忽略困难地形。之后它进行一次拳打击，在其攻击骰上获得+1环境加值。

Fleshforge Dreg (Reach).name: 血肉熔炉渣油 Fleshforge Dreg (长触及)

Fleshforge Dreg (Roots).name: 血肉熔炉渣油 Fleshforge Dreg (根)

Roots.name: 根 Roots
Roots.description: 该血肉熔炉渣油在其站立的表面生根。它获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.fJSNOw4zHGbIm4bZ]{快速愈合 Fast Healing 5}，直到它离开该位置。

Fleshforge Dreg (Shield).name: 血肉熔炉渣油 Fleshforge Dreg (盾牌)

equipment-Fleshforge Dreg Arm.name: 血肉熔炉渣油长臂 Fleshforge Dreg Arm

血肉熔炉渣油的长臂能够作为盾牌（硬度3，HP20，BT10）并且它获得盾牌格挡反应动作。

该原型在举起盾牌时AC是21。如果该盾牌被摧毁，它无法再使用其拳攻击。

硬度 HP BT
3 20 10

该血肉熔炉原型在[[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4轮}中无法再次使用其喷吐武器。

Frog Swarm.name: Frog Swarm
Frog Swarm.publicNotes: Swarms of centipedes are dangerous indeed, ravenous carpets of skittering hunger capable of devouring a traveler whole in a matter of minutes. Some alchemists submerge whole centipedes taken from swarms in their elixirs and some mutagens, claiming such infusions increase potency, though other say this is nothing more than quackish claptrap. Kobolds and mitflits are both known to incorporate swarms of centipedes into cunning traps, from simple pits filled with vermin or more complex affairs involving chutes that dump the vermin onto the heads of unwary intruders.

Giant Centipede (PFS 1-03).name: Giant Centipede (PFS 1-03)
Giant Centipede (PFS 1-03).publicNotes:
Most giant centipedes nest in small groups but hunt alone when they seek out food. Attempts to domesticate giant centipedes for use as guardians or pets generally end poorly, but some tribes of goblins, kobolds, and mitflits have developed effective methods of utilizing these vermin as guardians. Other tribes and some humanoid societies roast and eat centipedes, often with pungent peppers as a savory delicacy, although care must be taken in preparing the meal to avoid tainting the flesh with the creature's venom.

Hunters and scavengers that live amid dung and detritus, centipedes are a relatively common and often reviled threat faced by adventurers. Scurrying about with surprising speed on the scores of legs attached to their long, segmented bodies, centipedes strike with poisoned mandibles to slow and torment their prey with a vicious toxin before they settle down to feed in slow and disgusting leisure.

Giant Centipede Venom.name: Giant Centipede Venom
Giant Centipede Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:14]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 [[/r 1d6[poison]]] damage (1 round)

Stage 2 [[/r 1d8[poison]]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{措手不及 Flat-Footed} (1 round)

Mauling Throw.name: Mauling Throw
Mauling Throw.description:
需求 The giant short-faced bear has a creature grabbed

效果 The giant short-faced bear throws its grabbed target up to 20 feet in any direction and deals its claw damage to the target.

Rush.name: Rush
Rush.description: The giant short-faced bear Strides and makes a Strike at the end of that movement. During the Stride, the giant short-faced bear gains a +10-foot circumstance bonus to its Speed.

Attach.name: Attach
Attach.description: When a Glass River midge hits a target larger than itself, its barbed legs attach it to that creature. This is similar to Grabbing the creature, but the midge moves with that creature rather than holding it in place. The midge is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{措手不及 Flat-Footed} while attached. If the midge is killed or pushed away while attached to a creature it has drained blood from, that creature takes [[/r 1[persistent,bleed]]]{1} damage. @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escaping} the attach or removing the midge in other ways doesn't cause bleed damage.

Blood Drain.name: Blood Drain
Blood Drain.description:
需求 The Glass River midge is attached to a creature

效果 The midge uses its proboscis to drain blood from the creature it's attached to. This deals [[/r {1d4}]]{1d4 damage}, and the midge gains temporary Hit Points equal to the damage dealt. A creature that has its blood drained by a midge is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} until it receives healing (of any kind or amount).

Camouflage.name: Camouflage
Camouflage.description: The Glass River midge can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hide} in natural environments even if it doesn't have cover.

Goblin Skeleton.name: 地精骷髅 Goblin Skeleton
Goblin Skeleton.publicNotes: The most common skeletal minions are mere guardians.

Goblin Warrior (PFS 1-01).name: 地精勇士 Goblin Warrior (PFS 1-01)
Goblin Warrior (PFS 1-01).publicNotes:
地精部落的前线战士喜欢大部队作战——特别是当他们的数量足够让他们至少三打一的时候。

这些小型类人生物有着绿色或是灰色的皮肤，大大的脑袋和宽大的耳朵。虽然有那么一些地精是文明的，并且努力成为类人生物社群中正直的一员，但大多数依旧还是鲁莽而又邪恶的生物，以制造破坏为乐。这些地精纯粹只是为了片刻的欢乐而屠杀牲畜、偷走婴孩、或是烧毁建筑。他们沉迷于对那些被他们成为“长腿”——也就是那些比他们更高的类人生物——耍一些恶劣的把戏。

地精很迷信，对魔法有着强烈的敬畏，对火焰有着异乎寻常的迷恋；精通魔法或者火焰的地精会得到他们部族的尊敬。大多数其他类人生物都很难理解地精的观点：他们讨厌犬科动物却又热衷于和所谓的“地精犬”分享他们的巢穴，他们会无畏地攻击大型生物却又害怕马匹，他们鄙视蔬菜却又将腌菜作为美味佳肴。当然，对于一只地精而言，这些全都是极为明智的人生抉择。

Goblin Scuttle.name: 地精小跑 Goblin Scuttle
Goblin Scuttle.description:
触发 一个地精盟友在地精旁结束一个移动动作。

效果 地精@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.UHpkTuCtyaPqiCAB]{快步 Steps}。

Grasping Limbs (3-4).name: Grasping Limbs (3-4)
Grasping Limbs (3-4).disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:18|name:Immobilize Limbs] (受训)或@Check[type:engineering-lore|dc:16|name:Immobilize Limbs]{Engineering Lore} or @Check[type:azlant-lore|dc:16|name:Immobilize Limbs]{Azlant Lore} twice to immobilize the limbs, or @Check[type:deception|dc:18|name:Trick Limbs]{ Deception} twice to trick the limbs into grasping each other.
Grasping Limbs (3-4).hazarddescription: The limbs of smashed constructs line the bottom of the fissure, beneath the water. They desperately grab anything that gets too close.
Grasping Limbs (3-4).routine: (2 actions) The grasping limbs try to Grapple all creatures in the water (Athletics [[/r 1d20 +9 #Athletics]]{+9}). They then tighten around all creatures they have grabbed or restrained, dealing [[/r 1d8[bludgeoning]]]{1d8 bludgeoning damage }(@Check[type:fortitude|dc:17|basic:true|name:Grasping Limbs]).
Grasping Limbs (3-4).stealthdetails: (受训); @Check[type:perception|dc:20|traits:action:seek] (受训) to notice the construct limbs at the bottom of the pit.

They then tighten around all creatures they have grabbed or restrained, dealing [[/r 2d8[bludgeoning]]] damage (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:20|basic:true|name:Grasping Limbs]).
Grasping Limbs (5-6).stealthdetails: (受训); @Check[type:perception|dc:23|traits:action:seek](专家)to notice the construct limbs at the bottom of the pit.

Great White Shark (PFS 1-12).name: Great White Shark (PFS 1-12)
Great White Shark (PFS 1-12).publicNotes:
An apex predator among the coastal surface waters where it hunts, the great white shark is one of the largest shark species. These silent killers glide gracefully through the ocean, always in search of their next meal.

Sharks of all shapes and sizes have stalked the oceans, largely unchanged, since primordial times. They are efficient, ruthless predators with multiple rows of razor-sharp teeth capable of rending prey in an instant. Their uncanny ability to smell blood in the water means sharks might show up at any scene of aquatic carnage.

V45K2AmQDPCGIMET.name: 血液嗅觉
V45K2AmQDPCGIMET.description: The shark can smell blood in the water from up to 1 mile away.

Breach.name: Breach
Breach.description: The shark Swims up to its swim Speed, then @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.d5I6018Mci2SWokk]{Leaps} vertically out of the water up to 25 feet high, making a Strike against a creature at any point during the jump (this lets it attack a creature within 30 feet of the water's surface). After the Strike, the shark splashes back down into the water.

Savage.name: Savage
Savage.description:
需求 The shark hit with a jaws Strike on its most recent action this turn.

效果 The creature the shark hit takes [[/r 1d12[slashing]]] damage.

Strafing Chomp.name: Strafing Chomp
Strafing Chomp.description: The shark Swims up to half its swim Speed, makes a jaws Strike, and then Swims up to half its Speed further. The Strike deals half damage.

Greater Metallic Sod Hound.name: Greater Metallic Sod Hound
Greater Metallic Sod Hound.senses: metal sense (模糊感官) 60 尺, 黑暗视觉

Metal Sense (Imprecise) 60 feet.name: Metal Sense (Imprecise) 60 feet
Metal Sense (Imprecise) 60 feet.description: A metallic sod hound can sense metal objects within 60 feet as if using the scent ability.

Earth Glide.name: Earth Glide
Earth Glide.description: The metallic sod hound can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.H6v1VgowHaKHnVlG]{Burrow} through any earthen matter, including rock or metal. When it does so, the metallic sod hound moves at its full burrow Speed, leaving no tunnels or signs of its passing.

Greater Shadow Wisp.name: 高等幽影微灵 Greater Shadow Wisp

Light Weakness.name: 光亮弱点 Light Weakness
Light Weakness.description: 放出魔法光亮的物体（例如来自光亮术）对幽影微灵造成额外伤害。

Shroud.name: 朦胧 Shroud
Shroud.description:
需求 该幽影微灵的上一个动作是一次对相邻生物的幽影触须打击，并且命中。

效果 该幽影微灵快步进入该生物的位置，并且尝试@Check[type:acrobatics]检定对抗目标的反射DC，以将自身附着在目标的影子上。只要它保持附着，它随着目标移动，并且对该目标的攻击@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{措手不及 Flat-Footed}。该目标可以在自己的回合里花费一个移动动作，尝试一次反射豁免，对抗该微灵的特技DC来逃脱此朦胧。

Stretch Shadow.name: 阴影扩散 Stretch Shadow
Stretch Shadow.description:
需求 该微灵附着在一个活物上。

效果 该幽影微灵钻入被附着的生物的影子，对其造成[[/r 1d6[negative]]]伤害。它可以使用被附着生物的影子，对另一个至多距离10尺的目标进行一次幽影触须打击。

Breath Weapon.description: The greater steel mephit breathes shards of iron in a @Template[type:cone|distance:15] that deals [[/r 3d6[slashing]]] damage to each creature within the area (@Check[type:reflex|dc:19|basic:true] save). While frenzied, the cultist gains a +1 status bonus to attack rolls and a +2 status bonus to damage rolls, and they take a -2 status penalty to AC. The cultist can't voluntarily stop their frenzy. After their frenzy, the cultist is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued}.

Guard (PFS 1-17).name: Guard (PFS 1-17)
Guard (PFS 1-17).publicNotes:
Guards are rank-and-file members of a town watch or city guard, trained to look for trouble, take down criminals, and follow orders. They are a match for only the most fledgling of adventurers and criminals, but, given time, the settlement can usually muster them in numbers sufficient to neutralize most threats.

Larger societies rely on those with the authority and the ability to interpret and enforce laws. In good-aligned societies, these officials carry out their duties fairly. In neutral and evil ones, these officials can be harsh and cruel (with an altered alignment to reflect this), imposing severe punishments on those who can't pay for mercy.

Self-Loathing.name: Self-Loathing
Self-Loathing.description: A mitflit's self-loathing makes it easy to influence. It takes a -4 penalty to its Will DC against checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.tHCqgwjtQtzNqVvd]{Coerce}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.OX4fy22hQgUHDr0q]{Make an Impression}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.DCb62iCBrJXy0Ik6]{Request}.

Vermin Empathy.name: Vermin Empathy
Vermin Empathy.description: Mitflits can use Diplomacy to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.OX4fy22hQgUHDr0q]{Make an Impression} on and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.DCb62iCBrJXy0Ik6]{Request} things of arthropods (insects, spiders, scorpions, crabs, and similar invertebrate animals). Most arthropods have a starting attitude of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fuG8dgthlDWfWjIA]{Indifferent} to mitflits.

Baleful Blade.name: Baleful Blade
Baleful Blade.description: Any creature affected by the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.7ZinJNzxq0XF0oMx]{Bane} spell is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{措手不及 Flat-Footed} to Gwibble.

Sneak Attack.name: 偷袭 Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: The mitflit sneak deals an extra [[/r {1d6}[precision]]]{1d6 precision damage} to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{措手不及 Flat-Footed} creatures.

Vengeful Anger.name: Vengeful Anger
Vengeful Anger.description: As long as it isn't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened}, a mitflit gains a +2 status bonus to damage rolls against a creature that has previously damaged or tormented it.

Most arthropods have a starting attitude of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fuG8dgthlDWfWjIA]{Indifferent} to mitflits.

Hidden Movement.name: Hidden Movement
Hidden Movement.description: If Gwibble starts his turn @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected} by a creature or merely @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} from it, that creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{措手不及 Flat-Footed} against Gwibble's attacks until the end of Gwibble's turn.

Sneak Attack.name: 偷袭 Sneak Attack

Vengeful Anger.name: Vengeful Anger
Vengeful Anger.description: As long as it isn't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened}, a mitflit gains a +2 status bonus to damage rolls against a creature that has previously damaged or tormented it.

Ruffian Strike.name: Ruffian Strike
Ruffian Strike.description: A bandit deals [[/r {3}[precision]]]{3 extra precision damage} to a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{措手不及 Flat-Footed} creature.

Surprise Attacker.name: Surprise Attacker
Surprise Attacker.description: On the first round of combat, creatures that haven't acted yet are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{措手不及 Flat-Footed} to the bandit.

Sneak Attack.name: 偷袭 Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: The Hungry Blade apprentice deals an extra [[/r {1d6}[precision]]]{1d6 precision damage} to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{措手不及 Flat-Footed} creatures.

You're Next.description:

效果 Hungry Blade apprentice prisoner attempts an Intimidation check with a +2 circumstance bonus to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.action-macros.nEwqNNWX6scLt4sc]{Demoralize: Intimidation} a single creature it can see and that can see them.

Sneak Attack.name: 偷袭 Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: The Hungry Blade recruit deals an extra [[/r {1d6}[precision]]]{1d6 precision damage} to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{措手不及 Flat-Footed} creatures.

Surprise Attack.name: Surprise Attack
Surprise Attack.description: On the first round of combat, creatures that haven't acted yet are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{措手不及 Flat-Footed} to the Hungry Blade recruit.

You're Next.description:
触发 The Hungry Blade recruit reduces a creature to 0 Hit Points

Uncanny Climber.name: Uncanny Climber
Uncanny Climber.description: A giant gecko's feet allow it to climb virtually any surface, no matter how slick or sheer. If a giant gecko attempts an Athletics check to climb and critically fails, it gets a failure instead.

Injured Sewer Ooze.name: Injured Sewer Ooze
Injured Sewer Ooze.publicNotes:
These amorphous masses of sewage and other detritus make their way through filthy culverts beneath cities large and small.

Slimes, molds, and other oozes can be found in dank dungeons and shadowed forests. While not necessarily evil, some grow to enormous sizes and have insatiable appetites.

Injured Weak Otyugh.name: Injured Weak Otyugh
Injured Weak Otyugh.publicNotes:
Lords of sewers, ditches, and landfllls, otyughs are filthy monstrosities that stomp about on three massive legs in search of tasty garbage and refuse. Using two barbed tentacles to grasp and tear, guided by a third with a proliferation of eyes at the end, the otyugh has perfectly adapted to life in its cramped, disgusting environment, where it uses its appendages to see into tight spaces and grasp hidden prey.

Most assume that otyughs originally evolved in swamps and moved into sewers as civilization encroached on their natural habitats. True or not, they are now one of the larger predators in those dank environs. Otyughs are territorial, but they have been known to form loose collectives, even giving each other important-sounding titles like 'king of offal' and 'duchess of slime' to indicate their rank and station in their sludgy underworld beneath the streets.

Those who run across an otyugh might be surprised to hear it speak, shouting at intruders to leave its putrid home or demanding tribute in the form of trash or other prizes of dubious nature.

Jinkin (PFS 1-17).name: Jinkin (PFS 1-17)
Jinkin (PFS 1-17).publicNotes:
Jinkins are sadistic tinkers who steal and sabotage items and take great pride in their power to curse precious objects. They hold grudges and create convoluted plans for revenge whenever they feel slighted, such as when a creature dares to remove one of their curses. Rarely content to wreak simple mayhem, jinkins also take immense pleasure in torture and murder, though they prefer to lead victims into traps designed to capture or incapacitate rather than kill outright. Deep pits are favorites, since victims who survive the fall face a slow death from starvation and thirst. Jinkins enjoy gathering at the edge of pits to mock, tease, and torment.

Gremlins are cruel fey tricksters and saboteurs who have fully acclimated to life on the Material Plane, finding distinct niches for their inventive destructiveness. All gremlins delight in ruining or breaking things, whether it's something physical like a device or vehicle or something intangible such as an alliance or relationship. A gremlin's greatest joy is watching the collapse of complex creations, preferably after the lightest and slightest, carefully targeted push from the gremlin. Gremlins tend to denigrate, bully, or even slaughter their lesser kin, particularly mitflits, whom gremlins (and many others) derisively call "mites."

Jury-Rigged Annihilator.name: Jury-Rigged Annihilator
Jury-Rigged Annihilator.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:23](专家)to successfully disable the annihilator at the control box on the northwest ledge, @Check[type:thievery|dc:20] (受训)或@Check[type:engineering-lore|dc:15] (受训) to jam the mechanics of either of the two chain guns, or the "tail" mechanism where the plasma lance is mounted, preventing it from firing. Jamming the guns or tail requires first getting on top of the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} annihilator, which counts as difficult terrain. All attempts take 2 actions.
Jury-Rigged Annihilator.hazarddescription:
A gargantuan scorpion-like robot, covered in signs of damage, has been bolted into the canyon's rock walls.

Integrated Chain Gun Hardness 10, HP 40 (BT 20) per integrated chain gun

Plasma Lance Hardness 10, Plasma Lance HP 20 (BT 10)
Jury-Rigged Annihilator.routine: (2 Actions) When the plasma lance is ready, the annihilator uses it to attack as many PCs as it can, otherwise it attacks with its two integrated chain guns while the plasma lance recharges, spending one action for each of its two integrated chain guns that is still functional. This trap doesn't take a multiple attack penalty. If Synthetic Khismar is destroyed, the annihilator attacks as many creatures as possible.
Jury-Rigged Annihilator.stealthdetails: (受训) to notice it's still functional; noticing the annihilator is automatic

Personality Fragments.name: 人格碎片 Personality Fragments
Personality Fragments.description: 尽管没有灵魂供体的记忆，但缚魂人偶会分享其人格碎片。这使得灵魂娃娃和灵魂供体具有相同的阵营，并获得相应阵营特征。

Too Small to Wade.name: 小到不能涉水 Too Small to Wade
Too Small to Wade.description: 堪可尔太小了，这个房间里的泥浆对它来说属于困难地形。

Pack Attack.name: Pack Attack
Pack Attack.description: The lion deals 1d4 extra precision damage to creatures within reach of at least two of the lion's allies.

Pounce.name: Pounce
Pounce.description: The lion Strides and makes a Strike at the end of that movement. If the lion began this action @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}, it remains hidden until after the ability's Strike.

Sneak Attack.name: 偷袭 Sneak Attack

Kobold Dragon Mage (1-14).name: Kobold Dragon Mage (1-14)
Kobold Dragon Mage (1-14).publicNotes:
Kobold dragon mages use magic to carry out their secret schemes. The presence of a dragon mage in a kobold warren is one of the greatest testaments to the kobolds' claim to draconic heritage.

Kobolds are small, reptilian humanoids who carry physical similarities to true dragons. They lurk in dark spaces, usually tunnels and mines beneath the earth, in either warrens of their own design or complexes discovered and colonized after the original builders have moved on. Though kobolds are far more pragmatic than they are courageous, they use every inch of their cunning to even the playing field between themselves and other, stronger creatures. They attack from the darkness and at range, and kobold artificers and engineers master the art of simple but effective traps, which they use to protect their lairs. Kobolds are skilled at working together by necessity, and they often set up ambushes or hit-and-run assaults that allow them to do the most damage possible without being harmed in return.

Kobolds are diligent and hardworking creatures, though they often turn these virtues toward selfish ends. While some kobolds live in communal collectives that maintain neutral relations with the creatures around them, they can be easily swayed into serving malevolent powers or megalomaniac leaders. This is in part due to kobolds' innate pragmatism, as they would rather concede to servitude than risk being killed, but it is also in part due to a reverence for the power that kobolds generally lack. Dragons in particular are viewed with a deferential awe, and kobolds eagerly offer their services to such mighty and glorious creatures when they can. While kobolds may scheme against other leaders, especially those that control them via subjugation, dragons are usually viewed with adoration, no matter how brutal they might be to their kobold minions.

Illusory Retreat.name: Illusory Retreat
Illusory Retreat.description:
Frequency once per hour

需求 The kobold dragon mage is adjacent to at least one enemy.

效果 The dragon mage creates an illusion of itself in its square and then becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible} (with the effects of a 2nd-level @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.XXqE1eY3w3z6xJCB]{Invisibility} spell) for [[/br 1d4 #Duration Illusory Retreat]]{1d4轮}. The dragon mage can move up to half its Speed, but it must end its movement in a space that's not adjacent to any enemies.

This is a 1st-level spell that requires a somatic component.

Sneak Attack.name: 偷袭 Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: The dragon mage deals an extra [[/r {1d6}[precision]]]{1d6 precision damage} to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{措手不及 Flat-Footed} creatures.

Kobold Warrior (1-14).name: Kobold Warrior (1-14)
Kobold Warrior (1-14).publicNotes:
The typical kobold trains with agile weaponry, favoring the light pick for its use in crafting new tunnels to expand their domains through underground reaches. Kobolds are capable of landing sneaky strikes against unsuspecting foes but are just as quick to scamper off to safety when they don't, as a group, outnumber their enemies at least two to one.

Leopard (1-14).name: Leopard (1-14)
Leopard (1-14).publicNotes:
Leopards are among the smallest of the big cats, yet they are still dangerous creatures to tangle with. Leopard statistics can also be used for black panthers, white-spotted snow leopards, or tawny-coated cougars.

Few predators of the natural world can match the cat's talent for stalking and stealth.

Maul.name: Maul
Maul.description: The leopard makes two claw Strikes against a creature it has @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}. Both count toward its multiple attack penalty, but the penalty increases only after both attacks are made.

Pounce.name: Pounce
Pounce.description: The leopard Strides and makes a Strike at the end of that movement. If the leopard began this action @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}, it remains hidden until after this ability's Strike.

Sneak Attack.name: 偷袭 Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: The leopard deals [[/r {1d4}[precision]]]{1d4 extra precision damage} to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{措手不及 Flat-Footed} creatures.

Mauling Throw.name: Mauling Throw
Mauling Throw.description:
需求 The giant short-faced bear has a creature grabbed

效果 The giant shortfaced bear throws its grabbed target up to 20 feet in any direction and deals its claw damage to the target.

Rush.name: Rush
Rush.description: The giant short-faced bear Strides and makes a Strike at the end of that movement. During the Stride, the giant short-faced bear gains a +10-foot circumstance bonus to its Speed.

Construct Armor (Hardness 2).name: Construct Armor (Hardness 2)
Construct Armor (Hardness 2).description:
Like normal objects,a lesser guardian statue has Hardness. This Hardness reduces any damage it takes by an amount equal to the Hardness.

Once the statue is reduced to less than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its construct armor breaks and its Armor Class is reduced to 14.

Follow Trespasser.name: Follow Trespasser
Follow Trespasser.description:
触发 A creature moves through the lesser guardian statue's reach.

效果 The statue moves up to 15 feet in pursuit of the creature.

Lightning Platform (5-6).name: Lightning Platform (5-6)
Lightning Platform (5-6).disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:20|name:Ground the Electricity|traits:electricity,magical,trap] (受训) to ground out the energy or @Check[type:arcana|dc:23|name:Neutralize the Magical Charge|traits:electricity,magical,trap] (受训) to neutralize the magical charge
Lightning Platform (5-6).hazarddescription: A magnetically charged platform draws in armored creatures, then flings them up into the sky, where they are struck by lightning.

Lightning Platform (7-8).name: Lightning Platform (7-8)
Lightning Platform (7-8).disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:23|name:Ground the Electricity|traits:electricity,magical,trap] (受训) to ground out the energy or @Check[type:arcana|dc:26|name:Neutralize the Magical Charge|traits:electricity,magical,trap](专家)to neutralize the magical charge

Little Zura (1-2).name: Little Zura (1-2)
Little Zura (1-2).allSaves: +2 to fortitude saves vs. attempts to grapple or shove

Hard to Grapple or Shove.name: Hard to Grapple or Shove
Hard to Grapple or Shove.description: Little Zura gains a +2 to fortitude saves against attempts to grapple or shove.

Belly Grease.name: Belly Grease
Belly Grease.description: The slurk extrudes a slippery grease from its ventral glands to coat the floor under it and in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5], turning the affected area into uneven ground for 10 minutes, after which it dries to a putrid crust. The DC to Balance across the slime is 17.

Entangling Slime.name: Entangling Slime
Entangling Slime.description:
A creature struck by a slurk's slime squirt becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} and takes a -5-foot penalty to Speed for 1 hour or until the slime is removed. The slime can be removed with a total of three Interact actions by the entangled creature or creatures adjacent to the creature.

These actions don't need to be consecutive or made by the same creature.

Little Zura (3-4).name: Little Zura (3-4)
Little Zura (3-4).allSaves: +2 to fortitude saves vs. attempts to grapple or shove
