Sneak Attack.name: 偷袭 Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: A giant fox deals 1d4 extra precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{措手不及 Flat-Footed} creatures.

Malfunctioning Annihilator.name: Malfunctioning Annihilator
Malfunctioning Annihilator.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:26](专家)to successfully disable the annihilator at the control box on the northwest ledge, @Check[type:thievery|dc:23] (受训)或@Check[type:engineering-lore|dc:18] to jam the mechanics of either of the two chain guns, or the "tail" mechanism where the plasma lance is mounted, preventing it from firing. Jamming the guns or tail require first getting on top of the immobilized annihilator, which counts as difficult terrain. All attempts take 2 actions.
Malfunctioning Annihilator.hazarddescription:
A gargantuan scorpion-like robot, covered in signs of damage, has been bolted into the canyon's rock walls.

Integrated Chain Gun Hardness 10, HP 50 (BT 25) per integrated chain gun

Plasma Lance Hardness 10, Plasma Lance HP 26 (BT 13)
Malfunctioning Annihilator.routine: (2 actions) When the plasma lance is ready, the annihilator uses it to attack as many PCs as it can, otherwise it attacks with its two integrated chain guns while the plasma lance recharges, spending one action for each chain gun that is still functional. This trap doesn't take a multiple attack penalty. If Synthetic Khismar is destroyed, the annihilator attacks as many creatures as possible.
Malfunctioning Annihilator.stealthdetails: (受训) to notice it's still functional; noticing the annihilator is automatic

Malicious Spirits.name: Malicious Spirits
Malicious Spirits.disable: Two @Check[type:occultism|dc:23|name:Exorcise the Haunt|traits:hazard,haunt,complex] or @Check[type:religion|dc:23|name:Exorcise the Haunt|traits:hazard,haunt,complex] (受训) to exorcise the spirits. A creature can either inflict 4 mental damage to the haunt or permanently lower the DC of checks to exorcise the spirits 1 by succeeding at a @Check[type:diplomacy|dc:20|name:Calm the Spirits|traits:hazard,haunt,complex] check to calm the spirits, a @Check[type:nature|dc:20|name:Ward Against the Spirits|traits:hazard,haunt,complex] check to use kami-specific warding incantations, a @Check[type:occultism|dc:20|name:Leverage Haunt Lore|traits:hazard,haunt,complex] check to leverage obscure haunt lore, or a @Check[type:religion|dc:20|name:Lesser Exorcism to Weaken the Haunt|traits:hazard,haunt,complex] check to use a lesser exorcism. Any creature currently frightened by the haunt is a potential target for inflicting damage to the haunt; mental and positive damage only affect such a host creature if they choose to be affected, while force or similar damage harms both the haunt and the host equally.
Malicious Spirits.hazarddescription: A cadre of evil spirits assails people's minds throughout the stretch of forest. The spirits first afflict their hosts with visceral images of their own deaths, then try to recreate their deaths by forcing their hosts to inflict similar wounds upon themselves. Creatures frightened by the haunt appear to have ephemeral masks with horns, tusks, and yellow eyes over their faces.
Malicious Spirits.routine:
(3动作) On its initiative, the haunt uses its first two actions to attempt to terrify a random target in its area that is not already @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened}. The target must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:20|name:Resist Terror|traits:emotion,fear,mental,hazard,haunt] save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected and is temporarily immune to this haunt for 24 hours.

Success The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure The target is frightened 1. The value of the frightened condition does not automatically decrease by 1 at the end of each of the target's turns. Instead, the target can attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:18|name:Reduce Frightened|traits:emotion,fear,mental,hazard,haunt] save at the end of each of their turns to remove the condition.

Critical Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}. The value of the frightened condition does not automatically decrease by 1 at the end of each of the target's turns. Instead, the target can attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:18|name:Reduce Frightened|traits:emotion,fear,mental,hazard,haunt] save at the end of each of their turns to lower their frightened value by 1.

The haunt then spends an action to compels one of the creatures that it has frightened to harm itself with surrounding forest debris, its strength fueled by spirit possession. The creature must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:20|name:Resist Attacking Yourself|traits:emotion,fear,mental,hazard,haunt] save or attempt to Strike itself during its turn as its first action, using the haunt's statistics below. Note that frightened applies equally to the creature's attack roll and AC, and therefore does not affect the accuracy of the attack.

Visions of Death.name: Visions of Death
Visions of Death.description:
触发 Three or more creatures enter the haunt's area

效果 Spectral faces appear, and the haunt rolls initiative.

Blazing-Talon Surge.name: Blazing-Talon Surge
Blazing-Talon Surge.description:
需求 Meleeka is in Mastered Rain of Embers Stance

效果 Meleeka Strides twice. If she ends her movement within melee reach of at least one enemy, she can make a fire talon Strike against that enemy that deals an additional [[/r 1d4[fire]]] damage. If she hits the target enemy, she can immediately @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Tkd8sH4pwFIPzqTr]{Grab} them as a free action.

Explosive Deathdrop.name: Explosive Deathdrop
Explosive Deathdrop.description:
需求 Meleeka is in Mastered Rain of Embers Stance and has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}

效果 Meleeka lifts the creature high into the air and then slams it downward, causing a fiery explosion on impact. Meleeka attempts an Athletics check against the creature's Fortitude DC. She takes a -2 circumstance penalty to her check if the target is one size larger than her and a -4 circumstance penalty if it's larger than that. She gains a +2 circumstance bonus to her check if the target is one size smaller than her and a +4 circumstance bonus if it's smaller than that.

Critical Success As success, but the creature also takes [[/r 1[persistent,fire]]] damage.

Success The creature takes [[/r 1d4[bludgeoning]]] damage plus [[/r 1d4[fire]]] damage and falls and lands @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{倒地 Prone} in an unoccupied square adjacent to her (Meleeka's choice).

Upon landing, the creature is no longer grabbed.

Failure The creature is no longer grabbed.

Critical Failure As failure, but Meleeka falls prone.

Mastered Rain of Embers Stance.name: Mastered Rain of Embers Stance
Mastered Rain of Embers Stance.description:
需求 Meleeka is unarmored

效果 Meleeka enters the stance of an enraged phoenix, channeling her pain into resolve and holding her fingers as rigid as deadly talons while moving with quick, flickering gestures that resemble dancing flames. Meleeka gains a +1 status bonus to AC and saving throws and fire resistance 2, though if her current Hit Points are not equal to her maximum number of Hit Points, this status bonus increases to +3 and the fire resistance to 3. The only Strikes Meleeka can make are fire talon Strikes.

These deal [[/r 1d4[fire]]] damage; are in the brawling group; and have the agile, finesse, nonlethal, and unarmed traits.

Blazing-Talon Surge.name: Blazing-Talon Surge
Blazing-Talon Surge.description:
需求 Meleeka is in Mastered Rain of Embers Stance

效果 Meleeka Strides twice. If she ends her movement within melee reach of at least one enemy, she can make a fire talon Strike against that enemy that deals an additional [[/r 1d4[fire]]] damage. If she hits the target enemy, she can immediately @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Tkd8sH4pwFIPzqTr]{Grab} them as a free action.

Explosive Deathdrop.name: Explosive Deathdrop
Explosive Deathdrop.description:
需求 Meleeka is in Mastered Rain of Embers Stance and has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}

效果 Meleeka lifts the creature high into the air and then slams it downward, causing a fiery explosion on impact. Meleeka attempts an Athletics check against the creature's Fortitude DC. She takes a -2 circumstance penalty to her check if the target is one size larger than her and a -4 circumstance penalty if it's larger than that. She gains a +2 circumstance bonus to her check if the target is one size smaller than her and a +4 circumstance bonus if it's smaller than that.

Critical Success As success, but the creature also takes [[/r 2[persistent,fire]]] damage.

Success The creature takes [[/r 1d6[bludgeoning]]] damage plus [[/r 1d6[fire]]] damage and falls and lands @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{倒地 Prone} in an unoccupied square adjacent to her (Meleeka's choice).

Upon landing, the creature is no longer grabbed.

Failure The creature is no longer grabbed.

Critical Failure As failure, but Meleeka falls prone.

Mastered Rain of Embers Stance.name: Mastered Rain of Embers Stance
Mastered Rain of Embers Stance.description:
需求 Meleeka is unarmored

效果 Meleeka enters the stance of an enraged phoenix, channeling her pain into resolve and holding her fingers as rigid as deadly talons while moving with quick, flickering gestures that resemble dancing flames. Meleeka gains a +1 status bonus to AC and saving throws and fire resistance 2, though if her current Hit Points are not equal to her maximum number of Hit Points, this status bonus increases to +3 and the fire resistance to 3. The only Strikes Meleeka can make are fire talon Strikes.

These deal [[/r 1d4[fire]]] damage; are in the brawling group; and have the agile, finesse, nonlethal, and unarmed traits.

Minor Summoning Rune.reset: The trap resets each day at dawn.

Mitflit (PFS 1-02).name: Mitflit (PFS 1-02)
Mitflit (PFS 1-02).publicNotes:
Mitflits, also known as mites, are self-loathing and pitiful cowards, easily bullied into servitude by other creatures or even slightly more powerful mitflit leaders. They tame insects, spiders, and other such creatures to serve as faithful allies. Mitflits have lost most of their ancestral gremlin magic, leaving these incomplete beings full of doubt and insecurity. Mitflits find companionship in the other base creatures of the world, and forge bonds of friendship with vermin, the only other beings that seem willing to accept them. A social structure, even one in which they are bullied, partially fills the hole within mitflits' personalities, and they rarely rebel or rail out unless their rage hits a breaking point.

Gremlins are cruel fey tricksters and saboteurs who have fully acclimated to life on the Material Plane, finding distinct niches for their inventive destructiveness. All gremlins delight in ruining or breaking things, whether it's something physical like a device or vehicle or something intangible such as an alliance or relationship. A gremlin's greatest joy is watching the collapse of complex creations, preferably after the lightest and slightest, carefully targeted push from the gremlin. Gremlins tend to denigrate, bully, or even slaughter their lesser kin, particularly mitflits, whom gremlins (and many others) derisively call "mites."

Self-Loathing.name: Self-Loathing
Self-Loathing.description: A mitflit's self-loathing makes it easy to influence. It takes a -4 penalty to its Will DC against checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.tHCqgwjtQtzNqVvd]{Coerce}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.OX4fy22hQgUHDr0q]{Make an Impression}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.DCb62iCBrJXy0Ik6]{Request}.

Most arthropods have a starting attitude of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fuG8dgthlDWfWjIA]{Indifferent} to mitflits.

Murderous Bathhouse (3-4).hazarddescription: Linneus's grudge manifests as a haunt that isolates creatures in the bathroom and attempts to psychically drown them in one of three containers of water: the sink, the bath, or the wash bucket.

Murderous Bathhouse (3-4).routine:

Critical Success The creature is unaffected and temporarily immune for 1 minute.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure A ghostly version of the creature's face appears in the water of the sink, the bath, or the wash bucket. The creature immediately experiences the sensation of being underwater, and if it can't breathe water, it must begin to hold its breath to avoid suffocation. The haunt can affect only one creature per container remaining in the haunt. If the creature leaves the room, it's immediately freed.

Critical Failure As failure, but the creature immediately loses [[/r 1d4 #Actions]]{1d4} actions' worth of air.

Ogre Glutton (PFS 1-05).name: Ogre Glutton (PFS 1-05)
Ogre Glutton (PFS 1-05).publicNotes:
Ogre gluttons take the act of feeding to a horrific extreme, capable of extending their already cavernous mouths wide enough to gulp down a halfling. Stories of ogre gluttons being tricked into eating razor-edged shields or barrels filled with poisoned meat are common, but such tales are of little consolation to those who have been gobbled down whole by these ravenous giants. In addition to their sadistic table manners, ogre gluttons have a disturbing knack for coming up with violent "games" that are little more than drawn-out torments, yet those who somehow manage to beat a glutton at the rules of its own game can often enrage and frustrate the ogre enough that the resulting tantrum is more than enough distraction to afford a last-ditch escape from doom.

Ogres embody brutish, amoral violence and cruelty. Standing 10 feet tall and densely muscled, ogres are as strong as they are cruel. Ogres are sadists that enjoy remorseless murder, torture, degradation, and mutilation in all of its forms. Although they prefer to vent their violent urges on smaller humanoids-the smaller and more beautiful, the better-ogres promise a horrifying fate for anyone unlucky enough to fall within their meaty grasp. But for all their creativity in developing methods of violence, ogres often remain too dim-witted to realize that their playthings lack an ogre's robust fortitude and high pain tolerance, so most captives die far sooner than the ogres might prefer. Such a fate is perhaps preferable however, as those who survive too long as ogres' playthings suffer lasting mental scars from the horrifying abuse. A captive able to keep their wits can sometimes trick the brutes by promising treasure, meatier captives, or other crude amusements, taking advantage of an ogre's limited intellect to engineer opportunities to escape.

Ogres are social creatures only in the most debased sense. They gather together in groups called families, though members are not always related by blood. Ogres practice incest regularly, believing that it makes for stronger familial bonds, and most ogres are misshapen or mutated from generations of inbreeding. The most powerful ogre in any family is the "boss"-usually the family's patriarch or matriarch-while other ogres in the family learn to obey or risk being brutalized by the boss's loyal kin. Ogres lair in caves, crumbling ruins, or dilapidated shacks close enough to humanoid settlements or animal trails to make raiding easy. These lairs are filthy and frequently contain all-too-recognizable evidence of their depravity.

Palace Guard (PFS 1-17).name: Palace Guard (PFS 1-17)
Palace Guard (PFS 1-17).publicNotes:
Guards are rank-and-file members of a town watch or city guard, trained to look for trouble, take down criminals, and follow orders. They are a match for only the most fledgling of adventurers and criminals, but, given time, the settlement can usually muster them in numbers sufficient to neutralize most threats.

Larger societies rely on those with the authority and the ability to interpret and enforce laws. In good-aligned societies, these officials carry out their duties fairly. In neutral and evil ones, these officials can be harsh and cruel (with an altered alignment to reflect this), imposing severe punishments on those who can't pay for mercy.

触发 The pile of fireworks takes acid or fire damage.

效果 The fuse of one of the fireworks begins to burn and the pile of fireworks enters initiative immediately before the triggering creature or effect.

Explosive Blast.name: Explosive Blast
Explosive Blast.description:
触发 The pile of fireworks begins its turn.

效果 The pile of fireworks explodes, dealing [[/r 4d8[fire]]] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:22|basic:true]) save to all creatures within 15 feet.

Pile of Fireworks (5-6).name: Pile of Fireworks (5-6)
Pile of Fireworks (5-6).disable: @Check[type:crafting|dc:21|name:Remove Lit Firework] (受训), @Check[type:engineering-lore|dc:19|name:Remove Lit Firework] (受训), or @Check[type:explosives-lore|dc:19|name:Remove Lit Firework] (受训) to safely remove the lit firework or @Check[type:thievery|dc:21|name:Remove Lit Fuse|traits:action:disable-a-device] (受训) to remove the lit fuse from the firework.

Axe Vulnerability.name: Axe Vulnerability
Axe Vulnerability.description: A pine brute takes 5 additional damage from axes.

Sap.name: Sap
Sap.description:
A pine brute's bark secretes sticky sap. Any creature that hits the pine brute with a melee attack, is hit by the pine brute, or otherwise touches the pine brute must succeed at a @Check[type:reflex|dc:17] save or suffer the effects of a lesser tanglefoot bag, also becoming @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} until the sticky substance is removed. A creature striking the pine brute with a weapon or object can automatically succeed at this Reflex save by leaving the object stuck to the pine brute. The object can then be removed with a successful @Check[type:athletics|dc:17|name:Unstick Object] check (made as a single action).

A pine brute can have any number of objects stuck to it at a time. The pine brute can release a stuck object by using a single action, and the sap dissolves 1 minute after the pine brute dies, releasing all stuck objects.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.fYZIanbYu0Vc4JEL]{Effect: Tanglefoot Bag (Lesser)}

Port Peril Bar Fight (Last Catch) (1-2).name: Port Peril Bar Fight (Last Catch) (1-2)
Port Peril Bar Fight (Last Catch) (1-2).disable: @Check[type:intimidation|dc:17|name:Cow the Crowd] to cow a section of crowd or @Check[type:diplomacy|dc:20|name:Disperse the Crowd] to attempt to disperse it
Port Peril Bar Fight (Last Catch) (1-2).hazarddescription: An assorted crowd throws punches, flings bottles, and otherwise flies into chaos as a bar fight breaks out, clustering in six sections of one of Port Peril's drinking houses.
Port Peril Bar Fight (Last Catch) (1-2).routine: (2 actions) The bar fight uses its first action to make a general mayhem Strike against all creatures in any area that has not been disabled. Make one Strike against each enemy in the area and roll the damage only once for all targets. The bar fight then uses its second action to use Port Peril specialty.
Port Peril Bar Fight (Last Catch) (1-2).stealthdetails: -10 and no minimum proficiency to notice

Port Peril Specialty.name: Port Peril Specialty
Port Peril Specialty.description: The bar fight creates an effect unique to the bar, located at any point within the hazard (even within sections that have been disabled) as long as the entire hazard has not been disabled. The DC for each effect is 15.

strike-General Mayhem.name: General Mayhem
strike-General Mayhem.description: Damage can be bludgeoning, slashing or piercing.

Slippery When Wet.name: Slippery When Wet
Slippery When Wet.description: The sea splashes, a cask ruptures, or a patron from an aquatic ancestry uses a water-based ability, coating 4 contiguous 5-foot squares with the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Wu0xFpewMKRK3HG8]{Grease}. This effect is a Last Catch specialty.

Get the Goods!.description: Gaming chips, a money purse, or jewels from a broken necklace scatter across the ground. All creatures within a @Template[type:burst|distance:15] that could be enticed by material wealth must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:15] saving throw or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} for 1 round or until a creature has used an Interact action to scoop up the valuables. This effect is a Watchtower specialty.

Protoplasmic Extruder.name: 泥怪挤出机 Protoplasmic Extruder
Protoplasmic Extruder.disable: 两次@Check[type:occultism|dc:22|name:Disable Extruder|traits:complex,mechanical,magical,trap](专家)或一次@Check[type:thievery|dc:24|name:Disable Extruder|traits:complex,mechanical,magical,trap](专家)使其在下一回合失去动作。两次成功（或一次大成功）会使其完全失效；@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{解除魔法 Dispel Magic} (3环；反制DC20)会使泥怪挤出机在下一回合失去动作，但不会使其失效。
Protoplasmic Extruder.hazarddescription: 泥怪挤出机是一个由金属和加固软管组成的直径20英尺的球形装置，能够从匡提姆的下水道吸取奥法泥浆，并将其转化成危险的泥怪。
Protoplasmic Extruder.reset: 泥怪挤出机必须用24小时提纯下水道的奥法泥浆才能重新激活。
Protoplasmic Extruder.routine:
(1动作) 在陷阱的先攻轮，它会在一个相邻的未占据方格里制造一只泥怪。当泥怪挤出机第一次使用这个动作时，会制造出一个@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.TZcDdN5o7s4alZNE]{胶质怪 Gelatinous Cube}，它会立即行动，之后在泥怪挤出机的先攻轮行动。在接下来的轮次中，泥怪挤出机改为制造@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.Hkq9ZS2J2iKnT7vT]{下水道泥怪 Sewer Oozes}，并以相同方式行动。

泥怪挤出机产生的泥怪呈珍珠绿色；胶质怪失去了透明能力。所有由泥怪挤出机产生的泥怪都忠于欧何拉维兄妹并按照他们的命令行事。

泥怪挤出机在失效和重置前最多只能产生4只泥怪。
Protoplasmic Extruder.stealthdetails: (受训)；注意到泥怪挤出机的DC为0

Creator's Command.name: 建造者指令 Creator's Command
Creator's Command.description:
触发 比简·欧何拉维或载娜普·欧何拉维可以说话，并且在泥怪挤出机60英尺内骰先攻检定。

效果 泥怪挤出机开始运转地更吵，并骰先攻检定。

Efficient Capture.name: Efficient Capture
Efficient Capture.description:
需求 Ptiro has manacles in hand and is adjacent to a creature

效果 Ptiro attempts to bind the creature's wrists or ankles with the manacles. If Ptiro succeeds at an attack roll with a [[/r 1d20+9 #Manacles]]{+9 modifier} against the target's AC, they apply the manacles.

Intimidating Strike.name: Intimidating Strike
Intimidating Strike.description: Ptiro makes a melee Strike. If it hits and deals damage, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} on a critical hit.

Subdue Prisoners.name: Subdue Prisoners
Subdue Prisoners.description: Ptiro doesn't take the normal penalty for making a nonlethal attack when attacking with their club.

Quagmire.name: Quagmire
Quagmire.disable: @Check[type:survival|dc:15|name:Disturb Surface|traits:secret,action:sense-direction,exploration] (受训) to disturb the surface and make the quagmire plainly visible
Quagmire.hazarddescription: A patch of treacherous bog attempts to submerge creatures that step onto it.
Quagmire.reset: The hazard still submerges anyone who walks in, but the surface doesn't become hidden again until it settles over the course of 24 hours
Quagmire.routine:
(1动作) On its initiative, the quagmire pulls each creature within it 1 square toward the center of the quagmire and 1 step further submerged; a creature that is submerged up to its waist becomes submerged up to its neck, and a creature that is submerged up to its neck is pulled under and has to hold its breath to avoid suffocation.

A creature in the quagmire can attempt a @Check[type:athletics|dc:17|name:Swim Out of Quagmire|traits:environmental,hazard,action:swim] check to Swim to either raise itself by 1 step if its submerged to its neck or worse, or to swim out of the quagmire if its submerged up to only its waist. On a critical failure, the creature is pulled down 1 step. A creature that Swims out of the quagmire escapes the hazard and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{倒地 Prone} adjacent to the quagmire. Other creatures can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.HCl3pzVefiv9ZKQW]{Aid} the creature, typically by using a rope or similar tool, or attempt to pull a creature within their reach out with a @Check[type:athletics|dc:17|name:Pull Out of Quagmire] check, with the same results as if the creature attempted the check.

Rabid Squirrel Swarm.name: Rabid Squirrel Swarm
Rabid Squirrel Swarm.publicNotes: Swarms of centipedes are dangerous indeed, ravenous carpets of skittering hunger capable of devouring a traveler whole in a matter of minutes. Some alchemists submerge whole centipedes taken from swarms in their elixirs and some mutagens, claiming such infusions increase potency, though other say this is nothing more than quackish claptrap. Kobolds and mitflits are both known to incorporate swarms of centipedes into cunning traps, from simple pits filled with vermin or more complex affairs involving chutes that dump the vermin onto the heads of unwary intruders.

Raging Forest Fire.name: Raging Forest Fire
Raging Forest Fire.disable:
A successful @Check[type:athletics|dc:15|name:Smother Fire|traits:hazard,environmental,fire], @Check[type:nature|dc:15|name:Smother Fire|traits:hazard,environmental,fire], or @Check[type:survival|dc:15|name:Smother Fire|traits:hazard,environmental,fire] check from an adjacent square is sufficient to smother one 5-foot-square of fire; each attempt is an Interact action. Dousing the flames automatically extinguishes one or more sections of fire, with no check. Water typically clears a 5-foot square if the amount is small (such as that from @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.WzLKjSw6hsBhuklC]{Create Water} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.jfVCuOpzC6mUrf6f]{Hydraulic Push}). Larger amounts of water, such as a full bucket, typically douse a 10-foot-by-10-foot area (or 4 squares in some other shape). Throwing a bucket of water on flames requires an Interact action. A @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.VnPh324pKwd2ZB66]{Waterskin} doesn't contain enough water to put out even 1 square of fire.

Cold can also put out fire, but only if the cold can affect an area; cold is usually less effective than water, so a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.EpxmUtLpCkE8R6KJ]{Frost Vial} typically puts out only 1 square of fire, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.gYjPm7YwGtEa1oxh]{Ray of Frost} is ineffective.
Raging Forest Fire.hazarddescription: A fire engulfs a 10-foot-by-10-foot section of forest, then spreads on each of its turns.
Raging Forest Fire.routine: On its turn, the fire spreads into a number of additional squares equal to half the number of squares the fire currently occupies, minimum 1 square. The GM determines the squares the fire spreads into. Any creature that ends its turn next to the flames takes [[/r 1d6[fire]]] damage, and any creature within the flames takes [[/r 4d6[fire]]] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:15|basic:true|name:Raging Forest Fire|traits:hazard,environmental,fire] save for both). A creature can take damage from flames only once per round.

Sap Life.name: Sap Life
Sap Life.description: When Ralthiss casts a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.wdA52JJnsuQWeyqz]{Harm} spell and damages at least one living creature, he regains Hit Points equal to the spell level of his harm spell.

Necrotic Infusion.name: Necrotic Infusion
Necrotic Infusion.description:
If the next action Ralthiss takes is to cast harm to restore Hit Points to a single undead creature, the target then deals an additional [[/r 1d6[negative]]] damage with its melee weapons and unarmed attacks until the end of its next turn.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feat-effects.bIU1q05vzkKBtFj2]{Effect: Necrotic Infusion}

Sap Life.name: Sap Life
Sap Life.description: When Ralthiss casts a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.wdA52JJnsuQWeyqz]{Harm} spell and damages at least one living creature, he regains Hit Points equal to the spell level of his harm spell.

Raven Swarm (1-05).name: Raven Swarm (1-05)
Raven Swarm (1-05).publicNotes: A flock of ravens is known as an unkindness. Certainly the name lives up to its meaning when a swarm of ravens decides to work together. In most cases, a raven swarm like the one presented here won't attack larger foes, but when manipulated by supernatural forces or simple desperation born from hunger, an unkindness of ravens can be a surprisingly dangerous foe.

Swear Vengeance.name: Swear Vengeance
Swear Vengeance.description:
触发 A creature that Reast can see damages a follower of Groetus other than Reast

效果 Reast gains the effect of a 1st-level @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Gb7SeieEvd0pL2Eh]{True Strike} spell. If Reast makes an attack roll against anyone other than the triggering creature, the true strike ends with no effect.

Reast can use this reaction once per day.

Swear Vengeance.name: Swear Vengeance
Swear Vengeance.description:
触发 A creature that Reast can see damages a follower of Groetus other than Reast

效果 Reast gains the effect of a 1st-level @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Gb7SeieEvd0pL2Eh]{True Strike} spell. If Reast makes an attack roll against anyone other than the triggering creature, the true strike ends with no effect.

Reast can use this reaction once per day.

Channel Smite.name: Channel Smite
Channel Smite.description: Reast expends a prepared @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.wdA52JJnsuQWeyqz]{Harm} spell and makes a melee Strike. Instead of the normal effect of the spell, its negative damage is added to the Strike's damage.

Reefclaw (PFS 1-12).name: Reefclaw (PFS 1-12)
Reefclaw (PFS 1-12).publicNotes:
Reefclaws are aquatic monsters that resemble huge shrimp or lobsters. As one might expect from its name, a reefclaw's oversized claws are powerful weapons with their vicelike grip and the ability to inject potent venom into unfortunate prey.

While reefclaws can't speak, they are intelligent enough to understand the local language of humanoids near their hunting grounds. The creatures sometimes listen to conversations, either to gain intelligence on the best place to ambush aquatic or land-dwelling prey, or merely for entertainment value-reefclaws are particularly fond of listening to people with high-pitched voices. Reefclaws are usually solitary hunters, but small swarms of female reefclaws have been known to gather around a single male for mating purposes or together for the communal raising of their broods. In the latter case, the females will perform widespread hunts in order to bring back a large enough bounty to feed their young. Such hunting parties are extremely dangerous-they've been known to tip over small flshing boats and attack those who fall overboard.

Once a reefclaw has decided upon a course of action, it follows through even if doing so spells its own end. More than one reefclaw survivor has said that the creature released its bone-crushing grasp only after its brains were leaking from its broken skull, and even then the reefclaw was able to perform a terrible last slash as part of its dying breath. During mating season, female reefclaws are often a little more pragmatic and release their prey before endangering themselves and their offspring.

Despite their intelligence and the accompanying moral quandaries, reefclaws frequently find their way onto the dinner plates of land-dwelling hunters such as humans and hobgoblins. According to those who have a taste for reefclaw flesh, the meat is either delectably sweet or slightly tangy (in the case of warm-water reefclaws). Most civilized people who know of reefclaws' intellect find the act of eating them distasteful, but this does not dissuade unscrupulous nobles in coastal regions, for whom reefclaw meat is a delicacy well worth the expense. Likewise, fisherfolk whose focus is on the bottom line of their ledgers are more than willing to hunt the dangerous creatures-or, even better, hire out the task to naive adventurers.

Death Frenzy.name: Death Frenzy
Death Frenzy.description:
触发 The reefclaw is reduced to 0 Hit Points.

效果 The reefclaw makes a claw Strike before dying.

Reefclaw Venom.name: Reefclaw Venom
Reefclaw Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:17]

Maximum Duration 4 rounds

Stage 1 [[/r 1d6[poison]]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 [[/r 1d6[poison]]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} (1 round)

Rending Hands.name: 撕裂的手 Rending Hands
Rending Hands.disable: @Check[type:religion|dc:20|name:Exorcize the Spirits] (受训) 来安抚精魂。
Rending Hands.hazarddescription: 幻象手从地板撕出，抓向受害者的腿，并造成真实的伤口。
Rending Hands.reset: 潜在的精魂留存此处，在每个午夜重置作祟，直到这里发生的事情被公开为止。
Rending Hands.stealthdetails: (受训) 以听见地板下的抓挠声

Rending Hands.name: 撕裂的手 Rending Hands
Rending Hands.description:
触发 24小时内有生物再次通过区域C2。

效果 幽影的腐烂的手从目标身下的地板中钻出，抓挠它们的腿。这些手的外观根据作祟的原因有所变化（见下表）。

这些手造成[[/r (4d6+10)[slashing]]]和@Localize[PF2E.PersistentDamage.Bleed4d6.success]（@Check[type:will|dc:21|basic:true]豁免）。如果一个生物从作祟承受了任何伤害，这些爪子在目标的腿上留下撕裂的伤口，减少其陆地速度10尺（最低5尺），直到目标恢复到最大生命值为止。

业主 作祟表现
魔鬼大公信徒 硫磺的气味，以及炼狱语的哼唱（懂得炼狱语的PC，或者成功通过@Check[type:religion|dc:10|name:Recognize Chanting]，@Check[type:hell-lore|dc:10|name:Recognize Chanting]{DC10地狱学识}，或者@Check[type:mephistopheles-lore|dc:10|name:Recognize Chanting]{DC10梅菲斯托菲勒斯学识}检定的PC能辨认出该哼唱是向梅菲斯托菲勒斯的祷词）
缚魂玩偶制作者 腐烂的手上血肉剥落下来，露出里面的陶瓷（成功通过@Check[type:crafting|dc:10|name:Recognize Craftsmanship]或者@Check[type:occultism|dc:10|name:Recognize Craftsmanship]检定的PC，可以辨认出这是缚魂人形的制作工艺）
炼金实验家 化学品的气味盖住了腐烂，在手臂上可以看见精确的手术切口（成功通过@Check[type:crafting|dc:10|name:Recognize Cuts]或者@Check[type:medicine|dc:10|name:Recognize Cuts]的PC可以发现这些都是非必要的医疗手段）
奴隶主 这些手的手腕上仍然套着沉重的锁铐。
犯罪首脑 这些手上有纹身，并且有些完全没有手指（成功通过@Check[type:society|dc:10|name:Recognize Marks]或者@Check[type:underworld-lore|dc:10|name:Recognize Marks]{DC10黑街学识}的PC可以辨识出这些是地震前活动的帮派标志
误入歧途的法莱斯玛追随者 在作祟消失的时候，一股熏香的味道残留下来（成功通过@Check[type:religion|dc:10|name:Recognize Rites]或者@Check[type:pharasma-lore|dc:10|name:Recognize Rites]{DC10法莱斯玛学识}的PC可以辨识出这是法莱斯玛式葬礼用的气味）

Ruffian (Q11).name: Ruffian (Q11)
Ruffian (Q11).publicNotes:
Using their strength to bully others into submission, ruffians often work as bodyguards and enforcers for powerful criminals like charlatans and fences.

Some criminals are the desperate who have no option but to break the law to survive, while others choose a life of crime for thrills, forming gangs or underworld guilds that specialize in certain illegal ventures.

Scrabbling Hands.name: 乱抓的手 Scrabbling Hands
Scrabbling Hands.disable: @Check[type:religion|dc:16|name:Exorcize the Spirits] (受训) 来安抚精魂。
Scrabbling Hands.hazarddescription: 幻象手从地板撕出，抓向受害者的腿，并造成真实的伤口。
Scrabbling Hands.reset: 潜在的精魂留存此处，在每个午夜重置作祟，直到这里发生的事情被公开为止。
Scrabbling Hands.stealthdetails: (受训) 以听见地板下的抓挠声

Shark Commune 150 feet.name: Shark Commune 150 feet
Shark Commune 150 feet.description: The sea devil can communicate telepathically with sharks within range. It can communicate only simple concepts like "come," "guard," or "attack."

Aquatic Throwing.name: Aquatic Throwing
Aquatic Throwing.description: A sea devil invader's thrown weapons don't have their range increments halved when attacking from underwater or targeting an underwater creature.

Blood Frenzy.name: Blood Frenzy
Blood Frenzy.description:
需求 The sea devil is not @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} or already in a frenzy

触发 The sea devil deals bleed damage to a living creature.

效果 The sea devil flies into a frenzy that lasts 1 minute. While frenzied, the sea devil gains a +1 status bonus to attack rolls with its claws and jaws, gains a +4 status bonus to damage rolls with its claws and jaws, gains 11 temporary HP until the end of the frenzy, and takes a -2 status penalty to AC. The sea devil can't voluntarily stop its frenzy. After its frenzy, the sea devil is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued}.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.ScZ8tlV5zS0Jwnqn]{Effect: Blood Frenzy}

Bloodletting.name: Bloodletting
Bloodletting.description: When the sea devil deals piercing or slashing damage, it also deals @Localize[PF2E.PersistentDamage.Bleed1d4.success] if the target was @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{措手不及 Flat-Footed} or if the attack was a critical hit.

Season's Toll (3-4).name: Season's Toll (3-4)
Season's Toll (3-4).disable:
1 @Check[type:crafting|dc:25] or @Check[type:thievery|dc:25](专家)to rig up a dummy or other object to distract one of the trap's sensors, or

1 @Check[type:nature|dc:23] (受训) to temporarily befuddle one of the sensors with knowledge of primal magic.

Alternatively, inserting the correct key into an alcove's keyhole disables that alcove's sensor.
Season's Toll (3-4).hazarddescription: Arcs of primal energy emerge from the L-shaped stone wall at the center of each alcove.
Season's Toll (3-4).reset: The trap is powered by the Eternal Bloom. It resets after 5 minutes, at which time the doors to the vault slam shut once again.
Season's Toll (3-4).routine:
(4 actions) The trap loses one action per magical sensor disabled. On its initiative, the trap uses each of its actions to target one creature adjacent to or within an alcove with a negative effect that corresponds to the season opposite the one depicted on the alcove's murals (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:24] to resist). For the purposes of this trap, creatures who are within an alcove's landscape count are within that alcove. The trap can target only one creature per alcove per round.

Spring Alcove (death) The decay of late autumn takes hold of the target.

  • Critical Success The trap has no effect.
  • Success The target takes [[/r 2d6[negative]]] damage.
  • Failure The target takes [[/r 4d6[negative]]] damage.
  • Critical Failure The target takes [[/r 4d6[negative]]] damage and [[/r 1d6[persistent,negative]]] damage. Effects that use positive energy, such as the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.rfZpqmj0AIIdkVIs]{Heal} spell, automatically end this persistent damage.

Summer Alcove (cold) Winter's bitter chill descends on the target.

  • Critical Success The trap has no effect.
  • Success The target takes [[/r 2d6[cold]]] damage.
  • Failure The target takes [[/r 4d6[cold]]] damage.
  • Critical Failure The target takes [[/r 4d6[cold]]] damage;and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} for 1 hour.

Autumn Alcove (poison) Poisonous springtime pollen sprays at the target.

  • Critical Success The trap has no effect.
  • Success The target takes [[/r 2d6[poison]]] damage.
  • Failure The target takes [[/r 4d6[poison]]] damage.
  • Critical Failure The target takes [[/r 4d6[poison]]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}.

Winter Alcove (fire) Heat greater than the hottest summer afternoon engulfs the target.

  • Critical Success The trap has no effect.
  • Success The target takes [[/r 2d6[fire]]] damage.
  • Failure The target takes [[/r 4d6[fire]]] damage.
  • Critical Failure The target takes [[/r 4d6[fire]]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 hour.

Season's Toll (5-6).disable:
@Check[type:crafting|dc:28] or @Check[type:thievery|dc:28](专家)to rig up a dummy or other object to distract one of the trap's sensors, or @Check[type:nature|dc:26] (受训) to temporarily befuddle one of the sensors with knowledge of primal magic.

Alternatively, inserting the correct key into an alcove's keyhole disables that alcove's sensor.

Season's Toll (5-6).reset: The trap is powered by the Eternal Bloom. It resets after 5 minutes, at which time the doors to the vault slam shut once again.

For the purposes of this trap, creatures who are within an alcove's landscape count are within that alcove. The trap can target only one creature per alcove per round.

Spring Alcove (death) The decay of late autumn takes hold of the target.

  • Critical Success The trap has no effect.
  • Success The target takes [[/r (2d6+2)[negative]]] damage.
  • Failure The target takes [[/r (4d6+4)[negative]]] damage.
  • Critical Failure The target takes [[/r (4d6+4)[negative]]] damage and [[/r 1d6[persistent,negative]]] damage. Effects that use positive energy, such as the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.rfZpqmj0AIIdkVIs]{Heal} spell, automatically end this persistent damage.

Summer Alcove (cold) Winter's bitter chill descends on the target.

  • Critical Success The trap has no effect.
  • Success The target takes [[/r (2d6+2)[cold]]] damage.
  • Failure The target takes [[/r (4d6+4)[cold]]] damage.
  • Critical Failure The target takes [[/r (4d6+4)[cold]]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} for 1 hour.

Autumn Alcove (poison) Poisonous springtime pollen sprays at the target.

  • Critical Success The trap has no effect.
  • Success The target takes [[/r (2d6+2)[poison]]] damage.
  • Failure The target takes [[/r (4d6+4)[poison]]] damage.
  • Critical Failure The target takes [[/r (4d6+4)[poison]]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}.

Winter Alcove (fire) Heat greater than the hottest summer afternoon engulfs the target.

  • Critical Success The trap has no effect.
  • Success The target takes [[/r (2d6+2)[fire]]] damage.
  • Failure The target takes [[/r (4d6+4)[fire]]] damage.
  • Critical Failure The target takes [[/r (4d6+4)[fire]]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 hour.

Light Weakness.name: 光亮弱点 Light Weakness
Light Weakness.description: 放出魔法光亮的物体（例如来自@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.WBmvzNDfpwka3qT4]{光亮术 Light}）对幽影微灵造成额外伤害。

Shroud.name: 朦胧 Shroud
Shroud.description:
需求 该幽影微灵的上一个动作是一次对相邻生物的幽影触须打击，并且命中。

效果 该幽影微灵@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.UHpkTuCtyaPqiCAB]{快步 Steps}进入该生物的位置，并且尝试@Check[type:acrobatics]检定对抗目标的反射DC，以将自身附着在目标的影子上。

只要它保持附着，它随着目标移动，并且对该目标的攻击@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{措手不及 Flat-Footed}。该目标可以在自己的回合里花费一个移动动作，尝试一次反射豁免，对抗该微灵的特技DC来逃脱此朦胧。

Stretch Shadow.name: 阴影扩散 Stretch Shadow
Stretch Shadow.description:
需求 该微灵附着在一个活物上。

效果 该幽影微灵钻入被附着的生物的影子，对其造成[[/r 1d6[negative]]]伤害。它可以使用被附着生物的影子，对另一个至多距离10尺的目标进行一次幽影触须打击。

Blood Magic.name: Blood Magic
Blood Magic.description: When a skeletal mage casts a spell, either it gains temporary Hit Points equal to the spell's level for 1 round, or one target takes [[/r 1[negative]]] damage per spell level (if the spell already deals negative damage, combine this with the spell's initial damage before determining weaknesses and resistances).

Signature Spell.name: Signature Spell
Signature Spell.description: The skeletal mage can freely heighten the spells marked signature.

Widen Spell.name: Widen Spell
Widen Spell.description: The skeleton mage causes the next spell they cast to affect a wider area. If the next action they use is to Cast a Spell that has an area of a burst, cone, or line and does not have a duration, increase the area of that spell. Add 5 feet to the radius of a burst that normally has a radius of at least 10 feet (a burst with a smaller radius is not affected). Add 5 feet to the length of a cone or line that is normally 15 feet or smaller, and add 10 feet to the length of a larger cone or line.

Explosive Death.name: Explosive Death
Explosive Death.description:
When the skeleton is destroyed, its bones shatter and explode as the necromantic energy holding it together is released.

Adjacent creatures take [[/r 2d6[slashing]]] damage with a @Check[type:reflex|dc:13|basic:true] save.

Gallop.name: Gallop
Gallop.description: The mount Strides twice, with its Speed increased by 10 feet.

Undead Steed.name: Undead Steed
Undead Steed.description: Undead and creatures allied with them can Command a skeletal mount without needing to attempt a skill check.

Explosive Death.name: Explosive Death
Explosive Death.description:
When the skeleton is destroyed, its bones shatter and explode as the necromantic energy holding it together is released.

Adjacent creatures take [[/r 2d6[slashing]]] damage with a @Check[type:reflex|dc:13|basic:true] save.

Bloody.name: Bloody
Bloody.description: The skeleton is covered in dripping blood and gains @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.fJSNOw4zHGbIm4bZ]{Fast Healing 1}.

Explosive Death.name: Explosive Death
Explosive Death.description:
When the skeleton is destroyed, its bones shatter and explode as the necromantic energy holding it together is released.

Adjacent creatures take [[/r 1d6[slashing]]] damage @Check[type:reflex|dc:10|basic:true] save.

Smoldering Forest Fire.name: Smoldering Forest Fire
Smoldering Forest Fire.disable:
A successful @Check[type:athletics|dc:13|name:Smother Fire|traits:hazard,environmental,fire], @Check[type:nature|dc:13|name:Smother Fire|traits:hazard,environmental,fire], or @Check[type:survival|dc:13|name:Smother Fire|traits:hazard,environmental,fire] check from an adjacent square is sufficient to smother one 5-foot-square of fire; each attempt is an Interact action. Dousing the flames automatically extinguishes one or more sections of fire, with no check. Water typically clears a 5-foot square if the amount is small (such as that from create water or hydraulic push). Larger amounts of water, such as a full bucket, typically douse a 10-foot-by-10-foot area (or 4 squares in some other shape). Throwing a bucket of water on flames requires an Interact action. A waterskin doesn't contain enough water to put out even 1 square of fire.

Cold can also put out fire, but only if the cold can affect an area; cold is usually less effective than water, so a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.EpxmUtLpCkE8R6KJ]{Frost Vial} typically puts out only 1 square of fire, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.gYjPm7YwGtEa1oxh]{Ray of Frost} is ineffective.
Smoldering Forest Fire.hazarddescription: A fire engulfs a 10-foot-by-10-foot section of forest, then spreads on each of its turns.
Smoldering Forest Fire.routine: On its turn, the fire spreads into a number of additional squares equal to half the number of squares the fire currently occupies, minimum 1 square. The GM determines the squares the fire spreads into. Any creature that ends its turn next to the flames takes [[/r 1d6[fire]]] damage, and any creature within the flames takes [[/r 2d6[fire]]] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:13|basic:true|name:Smoldering Forest Fire|traits:hazard,environmental,fire] save for both). A creature can take damage from flames only once per round.

Sodden Floor.name: Sodden Floor
Sodden Floor.disable: @Check[type:crafting|dc:16|name:Reinforce Compromised Floorboards] (受训) to reinforce the compromised floorboards.
Sodden Floor.hazarddescription: The floorboards here are rotting and soft, giving way and dropping anyone above into the hole below.

Spear Launcher (Q9:1-2).name: Spear Launcher (Q9:1-2)
Spear Launcher (Q9:1-2).disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:18|name:Disable Spear Launcher] (受训) on the floor tile or wall socket
Spear Launcher (Q9:1-2).hazarddescription: A wall socket loaded with a spear connects to a floor tile in one 5-foot square.

Spear Launcher (Q9:3-4).name: Spear Launcher (Q9:3-4)
Spear Launcher (Q9:3-4).disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:22|name:Disable Spear Launcher] (受训) on the floor tile or wall socket
Spear Launcher (Q9:3-4).hazarddescription: A wall socket loaded with a spear connects to a floor tile in one 5-foot square.

Spiky Pit (1-2).name: Spiky Pit (1-2)
Spiky Pit (1-2).disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:12|name:Remove Trap Door|traits:mechanical,trap] to remove the trapdoor
Spiky Pit (1-2).hazarddescription: A wooden trapdoor covers a pit that's 10 feet square and 20 feet deep.
Spiky Pit (1-2).reset: Creatures can still fall into the trap, but the trapdoor must be reset manually for the trap to become hidden again.

Spiky Pit (3-4).name: Spiky Pit (3-4)
Spiky Pit (3-4).disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:12|name:Remove Trap Door|traits:mechanical,trap] to remove the trapdoor
Spiky Pit (3-4).hazarddescription: A wooden trapdoor covers a pit that's 10 feet square and 20 feet deep.
Spiky Pit (3-4).reset: Creatures can still fall into the trap, but the trapdoor must be reset manually for the trap to become hidden again.

Construct Armor (Hardness 6).name: Construct Armor (Hardness 6)
Construct Armor (Hardness 6).description:
Like normal objects, a spirit guardian statue has Hardness. This Hardness reduces any damage it takes by an amount equal to the Hardness.

Once the statue is reduced to less than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its construct armor breaks and its Armor Class is reduced to 16.

Follow Trespasser.name: Follow Trespasser
Follow Trespasser.description:
触发 A creature moves through the animated guardian statue's reach.

效果 The statue moves up to 20 feet in pursuit of the creature.

Spitting Acid 'Bushes' (5-6).name: Spitting Acid 'Bushes' (5-6)
Spitting Acid 'Bushes' (5-6).disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:20|trait:disable-device] or @Check[type:engineering-lore|dc:20|trait:disable-device] (受训) on each bush to collapse its acid pump into component parts (2 actions per bush).
Spitting Acid 'Bushes' (5-6).hazarddescription:
Four techno-organic "bush" structures featuring mini-acid pumps activate. The first lashes out with sharp "branches" as it activates, and then all of the bushes spit acid at movement nearby.

HP is 10 per bush with a BT of 5
Spitting Acid 'Bushes' (5-6).routine: (3动作) The trap loses 1 action each turn for each bush disabled. On each of the hazard's actions, one of the functional pumps spits acid at a creature within range. The bushes sense movement, only targeting creatures that moved from their space on their most recent turn. This trap does not attack any single creature more than once per round. It does not take a multiple attack penalty.

Spitting Acid 'Bushes' (7-8).name: Spitting Acid 'Bushes' (7-8)
Spitting Acid 'Bushes' (7-8).disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:23|trait:action:disable-device] or @Check[type:engineering-lore|dc:23|trait:action:disable-device] (受训) on each bush to collapse its acid pump into component parts (2 actions per bush).
Spitting Acid 'Bushes' (7-8).hazarddescription:
Four techno-organic "bush"; structures featuring mini-acid pumps activate. The first lashes out with sharp "branches" as it activates, and then all of the bushes spit acid at movement nearby.

HP is 14 per bush with a BT of 7
Spitting Acid 'Bushes' (7-8).routine: (3动作) The trap loses 1 action each turn for each bush disabled. On each of the hazard's actions, one of the functional pumps spits acid at a creature within range. The bushes sense movement, and they only target creatures that moved from their space on their most recent turn. This trap does not attack any single creature more than once per round. It does not take a multiple attack penalty.

Squirrel Swarm (1-04).name: Squirrel Swarm (1-04)
Squirrel Swarm (1-04).publicNotes: Swarms of centipedes are dangerous indeed, ravenous carpets of skittering hunger capable of devouring a traveler whole in a matter of minutes. Some alchemists submerge whole centipedes taken from swarms in their elixirs and some mutagens, claiming such infusions increase potency, though other say this is nothing more than quackish claptrap. Kobolds and mitflits are both known to incorporate swarms of centipedes into cunning traps, from simple pits filled with vermin or more complex affairs involving chutes that dump the vermin onto the heads of unwary intruders.

Construct Armor (Hardness 10).name: Construct Armor (Hardness 10)
Construct Armor (Hardness 10).description:
Like normal objects, the statue of Set has Hardness. This Hardness reduces any damage it takes by an amount equal to the Hardness.

Once the statue is reduced to less than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its construct armor breaks and its Armor Class is reduced to 20.

Brazier.name: Brazier
Brazier.description:
The statue carries a wide brazier full of hot coals. To make flaming coal Strikes or use Burn Alive, the statue must have the brazier held in one hand or otherwise have it within reach.

Instead of targeting the statue with an attack, a creature can target the brazier directly. The brazier has the same AC and saves as the statue.

Dealing 15 cold damage to the brazier or dousing it with at least 2 gallons of water extinguishes the coals. This prevents the statue from using Burn Alive and causes its ranged attacks to no longer deal 2d8 fire damage.

Burn Alive.name: Burn Alive
Burn Alive.description: The statue grinds a creature it has grabbed into the red-hot coals of its brazier. The target takes [[/r 3d6[fire]]] damage and [[/r 1d8[persistent,fire]]] damage

Steaming Fields (5-6).name: Steaming Fields (5-6)
Steaming Fields (5-6).disable: @Check[type:survival|dc:26](专家)twice to navigate a safe path
Steaming Fields (5-6).hazarddescription: A field of warm mist covers an open plain. Pockets of highly pressurized steam lie @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} in the earth; pressure releases jets of steam.
Steaming Fields (5-6).stealthdetails: (受训) to see steam vents erupting

Steaming Fields (7-8).name: Steaming Fields (7-8)
Steaming Fields (7-8).disable: @Check[type:survival|dc:30](专家)twice to navigate a safe path
Steaming Fields (7-8).hazarddescription: A field of warm mist covers an open plain. Pockets of highly pressurized steam lie @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} in the earth; pressure releases jets of steam.
Steaming Fields (7-8).stealthdetails: (受训) to see steam vents erupting

7Kzas1XFgp87Z0nN.name: 快速愈合 2 (while in paravaax's aura)

Breath Weapon.name: Breath Weapon
Breath Weapon.description: The steel mephit breathes shards of iron in a @Template[type:cone|distance:15] that deals [[/r 2d4[slashing]]] damage to each creature within the area (@Check[type:reflex|dc:17|basic:true] save). Creatures who fail their save against this effect also take @Localize[PF2E.PersistentDamage.Bleed1d6.success]. The steel mephit can't use its breath weapon again for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4轮}.

Storm Smite.name: Storm Smite
Storm Smite.description:
触发 The storm acolyte critically hits with a scimitar Strike

效果 The storm acolyte releases a blast of lighting in a @Template[type:burst|distance:10] centered on the target. A creature in the area other than the storm acolyte takes [[/r 1d6[electricity]]] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:13|basic:true] save). On a critical failure, such a creature is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened} for 1 round.

Storm Smite.name: Storm Smite
Storm Smite.description:
触发 The storm warrior-priest critically hits with a scimitar Strike

效果 The storm warrior-priest releases a blast of lighting in a @Template[type:burst|distance:10] centered on the target. A creature in the area other than the storm warrior-priest takes [[/r 2d6[electricity]]] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:15|basic:true] save). On a critical failure, such a creature is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened} for 1 round.

Submerged Shard.name: Submerged Shard
Submerged Shard.disable: @Check[type:survival|dc:13|name:Blunt Crystal] (受训) to blunt the crystal's edges without getting cut
Submerged Shard.hazarddescription: An immense, jagged piece of clear crystal 10 feet square and forty feet high juts up from the seafloor
Submerged Shard.reset: The hazard still damages any creature or object that enters its space, but the surface doesn't become hidden again until it settles over the course of 1 minute.

Shard.name: Shard
Shard.description:
触发 A creature or object moves into the shard's space.

效果 The triggering creature takes [[/r (2d6+5)[piercing]]] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:17|basic:true] save).

Summoning Rune (PFS 1-11).name: Summoning Rune (PFS 1-11)
Summoning Rune (PFS 1-11).disable: @Check[type:acrobatics|dc:15] to approach without triggering the trap followed by @Check[type:thievery|dc:17] (受训) to erase the rune, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{解除魔法 Dispel Magic} (1st level; counteract DC 15) to counteract the rune
Summoning Rune (PFS 1-11).hazarddescription: A cloud of invisible magical sensors covers four squares on the map. One of these hazards is in the squares directly above each of the four yellow runes on the map, and the other is in the squares directly above each of the four blue runes on the map.
Summoning Rune (PFS 1-11).reset: The trap resets each day at dawn.

Trapmaster Tok's Surprise (1-2).name: Trapmaster Tok's Surprise (1-2)
Trapmaster Tok's Surprise (1-2).disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:20|name:Disable Floor Panels|traits:mechanical,trap] (受训) on the floor panels before the barrel falls
Trapmaster Tok's Surprise (1-2).hazarddescription: Pressure sensitive panels in the floor connect to a barrel of debris hidden in the hallway's ceiling

Trapmaster Tok's Surprise (3-4).name: Trapmaster Tok's Surprise (3-4)
Trapmaster Tok's Surprise (3-4).disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:23|name:Disable Floor Panels|traits:mechanical,trap] (受训) on the floor panels before the barrel falls
Trapmaster Tok's Surprise (3-4).hazarddescription: Pressure sensitive panels in the floor connect to a barrel of debris hidden in the hallway's ceiling

Treacherous Quagmire.name: Treacherous Quagmire
Treacherous Quagmire.disable: @Check[type:survival|dc:18|name:Disturb Surface|traits:secret,action:sense-direction,exploration] (受训) to disturb the surface and make the quagmire plainly visible.
Treacherous Quagmire.hazarddescription: A patch of treacherous bog attempts to submerge creatures that step onto it.
Treacherous Quagmire.reset: The hazard still submerges anyone who walks in, but the surface doesn't become hidden again until it settles over the course of 24 hours
Treacherous Quagmire.routine:
(1动作) On its initiative, the quagmire pulls each creature within it 1 square toward the center of the quagmire and 1 step further submerged; a creature that is submerged up to its waist becomes submerged up to its neck, and a creature that is submerged up to its neck is pulled under and has to hold its breath to avoid suffocation.

A creature in the quagmire can attempt a @Check[type:athletics|dc:20|name:Swim Out of Quagmire|traits:environmental,hazard,action:swim] check to Swim to either raise itself by 1 step if its submerged to its neck or worse, or to swim out of the quagmire if its submerged up to only its waist. On a critical failure, the creature is pulled down 1 step. A creature that Swims out of the quagmire escapes the hazard and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{倒地 Prone} adjacent to the quagmire. Other creatures can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.HCl3pzVefiv9ZKQW]{Aid} the creature, typically by using a rope or similar tool, or attempt to pull a creature within their reach out with a @Check[type:athletics|dc:20|name:Pull Out of Quagmire|traits:environmental,hazard,action:aid] check, with the same results as if the creature attempted the check.

Unkillable Zombie Brute (PFS 1-01).name: 无敌蛮力丧尸 Unkillable Zombie Brute (PFS 1-01)
Unkillable Zombie Brute (PFS 1-01).publicNotes:
死灵法术增强了这具丧尸的体型和力量。

丧尸唯一的欲求便是啃食活物。丧尸作为永不停歇地蹒跚前行且不会思考的死亡之兆，只有将其摧毁才能使之停步。

Slow.name: 缓慢 Slow
Slow.description: 丧尸具有永久性的@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 1}且无法使用反应动作。

Corpse Throwing.name: 投掷尸体 Corpse Throwing
Corpse Throwing.description: 丧尸巨人能向敌人投掷尸体。笨重丧尸能向敌人投掷尸体。尽管任何中型的死尸都可以用于投掷，但它们有时会投掷@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.0plBflWwrCWQO2RO]{蹒跚丧尸 Zombie Shamblers}，这时蹒跚丧尸会承受与被投掷命中目标相同的伤害。被投掷的蹒跚丧尸会以@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{倒地 Prone}状态落地，但如果它没有被摧毁的话，则可以如常使用其他动作和起身。

Wide Swing.name: 大幅摆动 Wide Swing
Wide Swing.description: 笨重丧尸可以用血肉团块进行一次打击，并用攻击结果与至多2个敌人进行比较，每个被攻击的目标都必须在打击的触及范围内。此次攻击在计算笨重丧尸多次攻击减值时被视为2次攻击。

Unkillable Zombie Brute (PFS 1-13).name: Unkillable Zombie Brute (PFS 1-13)
Unkillable Zombie Brute (PFS 1-13).publicNotes:
Necromantic augmentations have granted this zombie increased size and power.

A zombie's only desire is to consume the living. Unthinking and ever-shambling harbingers of death, zombies stop only when they're destroyed.

Vengeful Spirits.name: Vengeful Spirits
Vengeful Spirits.disable: Two @Check[type:occultism|dc:26|name:Exorcise the Haunt|traits:hazard,haunt,complex] or @Check[type:religion|dc:26|name:Exorcise the Haunt|traits:hazard,haunt,complex] (受训) to exorcise the spirits. A creature can either inflict 4 mental damage to the haunt or permanently lower the DC of checks to exorcise the spirits 1 by succeeding at a @Check[type:diplomacy|dc:22|name:Calm the Spirits|traits:hazard,haunt,complex] check to calm the spirits, a @Check[type:nature|dc:22|name:Ward Against the Spirits|traits:hazard,haunt,complex] check to use kami-specific warding incantations, a @Check[type:occultism|dc:20|name:Leverage Haunt Lore|traits:hazard,haunt,complex] check to leverage obscure haunt lore, or a @Check[type:religion|dc:22|name:Lesser Exorcism to Weaken the Haunt|traits:hazard,haunt,complex] check to use a lesser exorcism. Any creature currently frightened by the haunt is a potential target for inflicting damage to the haunt; mental and positive damage only affect such a host creature if they choose to be affected, while force or similar damage harms both the haunt and the host equally.
Vengeful Spirits.hazarddescription: A cadre of evil spirits assails people's minds throughout the stretch of forest. The spirits first afflict their hosts with visceral images of their own deaths, then try to recreate their deaths by forcing their hosts to inflict similar wounds upon themselves. Creatures frightened by the haunt appear to have ephemeral masks with horns, tusks, and yellow eyes over their faces.
Vengeful Spirits.routine:
(3动作) On its initiative, the haunt uses its first two actions to attempt to terrify a random target in its area that is not already @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened}. The target must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:22|name:Resist Terror|traits:emotion,fear,mental,hazard,haunt] save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected and is temporarily immune to this haunt for 24 hours.

Success The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure The target is frightened 1. The value of the frightened condition does not automatically decrease by 1 at the end of each of the target's turns. Instead, the target can attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:18|name:Reduce Frightened|traits:emotion,fear,mental,hazard,haunt] save at the end of each of their turns to lower their frightened value by 1.

Critical Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}. The value of the frightened condition does not automatically decrease by 1 at the end of each of the target's turns. Instead, the target can attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:18|name:Reduce Frightened|traits:emotion,fear,mental,hazard,haunt] save at the end of each of their turns to lower their frightened value by 1.

The haunt then spends an action to compels one of the creatures that it has frightened to harm itself with surrounding forest debris, its strength fueled by spirit possession. The creature must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:22|name:Resist Attacking Yourself|traits:emotion,fear,mental,hazard,haunt] save or attempt to Strike itself during its turn as its first action, using the haunt's statistics below. Note that frightened applies equally to the creature's attack roll and AC, and therefore does not affect the accuracy of the attack.

Visions of Death.name: Visions of Death
Visions of Death.description:
触发 Three or more creatures enter the haunt's area

效果 Spectral faces appear, and the haunt rolls initiative.

Pounce.name: Pounce
Pounce.description: The vicious vulpine Strides and makes a Strike at the end of that movement. If the fox begins this action hidden, it remains hidden until after this ability's Strike.

Sneak Attack.name: 偷袭 Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: A vicious vulpine deals 1d4 extra precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{措手不及 Flat-Footed} creatures.

equipment-Large Bark Shield.name: 大皮盾 Large Bark Shield
equipment-Large Bark Shield.description:
Though they come in a variety of shapes and sizes, the protection offered by wooden shields comes from the stoutness of their materials. While wooden shields are less expensive than steel shields, they break more easily.

Hardness HP BT
3 20 10

Axe Vulnerability.name: Axe Vulnerability
Axe Vulnerability.description: An arboreal warden takes 5 additional damage from axes.

Shield Push.name: Shield Push
Shield Push.description: The arboreal warden Strides and then makes a shield bash Strike. If the attack hits, the target is pushed 10 feet.

Weak Ceustodaemon (PFS 1-01).name: 弱化仆役邪魔 Weak Ceustodaemon (PFS 1-01)
Weak Ceustodaemon (PFS 1-01).publicNotes:
仆役邪魔由各种邪恶的凡人灵魂形成，尤其是那些试图加速自己死亡让自己变成邪魔仆从的人们。他们超凡的感官让他们在守护宝库或主物质位面的其他类似的地点时非常有用。仆役邪魔是为侍奉而生的，但是总是在想方设法挣脱束缚，因此它们可能会撕裂召唤它们的凡人的肉体。最邪恶的召唤者把仆役邪魔释放到凡间有时仅仅是为了取悦末日荒原的邪恶力量。

作为荒凉恐怖的末日荒原的居民，邪魔被塑造成致力于于毁灭一切形式的生命。它们会尝试用最痛苦和最恐怖的方式杀死每个凡人，所有这些都是为了服侍被称为天启的四驭者（Four Horsemen）。每一种邪魔代表一种不同的死亡方式，它们的力量几乎总是为了传播这种特定的死亡方式而存在。通过这种力量，它们试图把所有生灵都拖入绝望的深渊，并让所有灵魂泯灭。

虽然那些把邪魔召唤到主物质位面的人通常会利用这些生物的破坏力和腐化能力来达到自己的目的，但是邪魔们自身也在不断寻找传播恐惧、怀疑和绝望的方法。通常邪魔会隐藏自己的阴谋并替其他魔族（fiends）办事，这造成的混乱会加剧凡人们的恐惧。

虽然所有邪魔族都会试图引诱凡人们堕入邪道，用这种方法增加自身的数量和自己家乡位面的力量，但是邪魔对凡人灵魂的渴望则更进一步，并会使用各种方法——尤其是狂躁邪魔的灵魂宝石——来引诱他们。在末日荒原以及其他很多多重宇宙中令人生畏的国度里，灵魂是美味的飨宴、是交易的货币同时也是魔法力量的源泉。而邪魔则是所有这些地方的居民中最强大的食客、商人和灵魂“资源”的使用者。

Breath Weapon.name: 吐息 Breath Weapon
Breath Weapon.description:
该仆役邪魔喷出@Template[type:cone|distance:30]火焰。在锥形范围内的生物承受[[/r 6d6[fire]]]伤害（@Check[type:reflex|dc:22|basic:true]豁免）。

该仆役邪魔以及在豁免中失败的生物会着火，承受[[/r 1d6[persistent,fire]]]伤害。

该吐息在[[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4轮}内无法再次使用。

Drawn to Service.name: 乐于侍奉 Drawn to Service
Drawn to Service.description: 当施展类似@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.2ykmAVKrsAWcazcC]{异界誓缚 Planar Binding}或@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.vgy00hnqxN9VoeoF]{异界盟友 Planar Ally}之类的仪式将仆役邪魔召唤到其他位面时，该仪式的主要检定或次要检定技能DC减少5，并且仆役邪魔的服务只需要正常开销的一半。

Vicious Wounds.name: 恶毒之伤 Vicious Wounds
Vicious Wounds.description:
当仆役邪魔的咬打击或爪打击成功时，仆役邪魔会恶毒地撕裂猎物，它的身躯上会出现类似的伤口。目标受到额外[[/r 1d6]]{1d6伤害}，仆役邪魔也受到同样的额外伤害。

如果该额外伤害因为重击变为双倍，则仆役邪魔同样受到双倍伤害。

Weak Green Hag.name: Weak Green Hag
Weak Green Hag.publicNotes:
Green hags hate beauty and purity, so they use disguises and treachery to lure and murder innocents, corrupt the pure of heart, and shatter the minds and morals of their victims. Green hags create imaginative schemes to utterly ruin anyone who crosses them, as well as good or righteous folk whose very existence insults the hag's twisted sensibilities. The complicated scandals perpetuated by green hags involve impersonation, mistaken identity, the seduction and betrayal of loved ones, or all these things in combination.

Malevolent crones who lurk at the edges of civilization, hags use their deceptive, magical abilities to prey upon humanoids, manipulating and corrupting them. Some say hags arose from fey that became twisted by their inner selfishness. Hags gather together in covens for greater power, craft unique magical items known as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.ACa9QlFqdmW4s2Th]{Hag Eyes}, and are known to replace infant humanoids with their own offspring-these children are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.bAjHCeyNcPRqOmLv]{Changelings} who have the potential to become hags themselves.

Coven.name: 巫团 Coven
Coven.description:
A green hag adds @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.J6vNvrUT3b1hx2iA]{Entangle}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.KSAEhNfZyXMO7Z7V]{Outcast's Curse}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.KsWhliKfUs3IpW3c]{Wall of Thorns} to her coven's spells.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Coven]

Sound Imitation.name: Sound Imitation
Sound Imitation.description: A green hag who succeeds at a Deception check to Lie can mimic the sounds of any animal found near her lair. She has a +4 circumstance bonus to this check.

Betraying Touch.name: Betraying Touch
Betraying Touch.description: The green hag touches a creature that doesn't realize the hag is an enemy. The betrayed creature is affected by the hag's enfeebling humors and takes a -4 circumstance penalty to their saving throw against that effect.

Change Shape.name: 变身 Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
The green hag can take on the appearance of any Medium humanoid woman. This doesn't change her Speed or her attack and damage bonuses with her Strikes, but might change the damage type her Strikes deal (typically to bludgeoning).

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Enfeebling Humors.name: Enfeebling Humors
Enfeebling Humors.description: A creature damaged by a hag's claw must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:20] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} for 1 day. On a critical failure, or if it gets hit again and fails its save a second time, it's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} for 1 day.

Exhale Miasma.name: Exhale Miasma
Exhale Miasma.description:
The green hag exhales a miasma of green vapors. Each living creature in a @Template[type:cone|distance:15] is affected by her enfeebling humors (attemping a save as normal).

She can't use Exhale Miasma again for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4轮}.

Homunculus Poison.name: Homunculus Poison
Homunculus Poison.description:
A homunculus has one dose of poison in a reservoir in its head. It can refill this poison from its reserves with an Interact action.

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:13]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 [[/r 1d6[poison]]] and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 round)

Weak Spider Swarm.name: Weak Spider Swarm
Weak Spider Swarm.publicNotes:
An abundance of food, the sudden hatching of a clutch of eggs, or magical influence can cause smaller spiders to gather in terrifying, deadly masses.

Few everyday vermin inspire as much dread as the infamous spider.

Whispering Souls.name: 低语灵魂 Whispering Souls
Whispering Souls.disable: @Check[type:religion|dc:19|name:Supress the Spirits] (受训) 来抑制住精魂，或者@Check[type:performance|dc:19|name:Drown Out the Spirits] (受训) 把它们拉出幻觉。
Whispering Souls.hazarddescription: 迷惘的幽灵低语着，展现着他们的最后时刻，并将生者拖入他们的幻觉中。
Whispering Souls.reset: 潜在的精魂留存此处，在每个午夜重置作祟，直到这里发生的事情被公开为止。

Luring Whispers.name: 诱惑低语 Luring Whispers
Luring Whispers.description:
触发 多个生物在区域C4停留超过6秒。

效果 这些低语变得更加迫切，直到房间里的每个角色尝试一次@Check[type:will|dc:21]豁免。

在失败时，生物会@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{困惑 Confused}1轮（或者在大失败时[[/br 1d6+1 #rounds]]{1d6+1轮}）。此困惑效果的胡言乱语和作祟的来源相关。

主人 低语和咕哝
魔鬼大公信徒 竭尽全力赞美梅菲斯托菲勒斯。
缚魂玩偶制作者 乞求着“不要让我再进人偶里面了”
炼金实验家 狂乱地喊着不想永远活下去
奴隶主 各种语言的请求被释放
犯罪首领 保证不再给家族添乱
误入歧途的法莱斯玛追随者 想要得到安息的叹息

Whispering Spirits.name: 低语精魂 Whispering Spirits

Whispering Spirits.hazarddescription: 迷惘的幽灵低语着，展现着他们的最后时刻，并将生者拖入他们的幻觉中。
Whispering Spirits.reset: 潜在的精魂留存此处，在每个午夜重置作祟，直到这里发生的事情被公开为止。

效果 这些低语变得更加迫切，直到房间里的每个角色尝试一次@Check[type:will|dc:18]豁免。

Witchwyrd (PFS 1-21).name: Witchwyrd (PFS 1-21)
Witchwyrd (PFS 1-21).publicNotes:
Witchwyrds conceal most of their faces, leaving only their eyes unmasked. Their inscrutability is a boon to one of their most significant interests-mercantilism- and many haughty witchwyrds openly revel in the befuddlement inspired by their mysterious guises and mannerisms. Witchwyrds have a keen eye for new opportunities and markets, and a witchwyrd almost always knows when someone is trying to pull one over on them.

These four-armed humanoid creatures have hairless blue-gray skin, are typically 6-1/2 feet tall, and weigh 300 pounds. Their hands have three evenly sized and spaced digits in a tripod-like arrangement. When not trying to blend in with the local community, witchwyrds favor outlandish, loose-fitting clothes in bright reds or yellows and a signature conical hat. They tend to prefer the driest, warmest regions of the lands they visit-perhaps an indicator of their mysterious home world. This, however, is the only indicator; witchwyrds are notoriously close-mouthed about details of this distant world, and with good reason: most witchwyrds on Golarion have never visited their ancestral home. To these witchwyrds, the notion of a home planet is a constant thorn in their side, and when asked, many choose to ignore the question altogether. Others are so agitated by these queries that they respond with impatience or even violence. Some scholars have theorized a connection between witchwyrds and several other four-armed creatures, but like with questions of their place of origin, witchwyrds have little to say about the topic.

Young Bloodseeker Swarm.name: Young Bloodseeker Swarm
Young Bloodseeker Swarm.publicNotes: Swarms of centipedes are dangerous indeed, ravenous carpets of skittering hunger capable of devouring a traveler whole in a matter of minutes. Some alchemists submerge whole centipedes taken from swarms in their elixirs and some mutagens, claiming such infusions increase potency, though other say this is nothing more than quackish claptrap. Kobolds and mitflits are both known to incorporate swarms of centipedes into cunning traps, from simple pits filled with vermin or more complex affairs involving chutes that dump the vermin onto the heads of unwary intruders.

Swarming Bites.name: Swarming Bites
Swarming Bites.description: Each enemy in the swarm's space takes [[/r 1d8[piercing]]] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:20|basic:true] save) and [[/r 1[persistent,bleed]]] damage. The young bloodseeker swarm gains temporary Hit Points equal to the damage dealt. A creature that takes damage from the bloodseeker swarm is drained 1 until it receives healing (of any kind or amount).

Spine Rake.name: Spine Rake
Spine Rake.description: The young sea serpent extends the spines along its back and Swims or Strides. Each creature the serpent is adjacent to at any point during its movement takes [[/r (1d4+2)[slashing]]] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:14|basic:true] save).

Young Sea Serpent Algae.name: Young Sea Serpent Algae
Young Sea Serpent Algae.description:
The water in the ballast organs around the sea serpent's neck is full of psychotropic algae.

Saving throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:18|name:Young Sea Serpent Algae Poison]

Maximum duration 3 rounds

Zombie Brute (PFS 1-18).publicNotes:
Necromantic augmentations have granted this zombie increased size and power.

A zombie's only desire is to consume the living. Unthinking and ever-shambling harbingers of death, zombies stop only when they're destroyed.

The zombie emits an aura of rot and disease that causes wounds to fester and turn sour.

Any living creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the zombie and is not at full Hit Points takes [[/r 1d6]]{1d6 damage} as its wounds fester. Creatures that take a critical hit from the zombie also take this damage immediately.
